Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment entries on my credit report regarding my account with XXXX XXXX  ( Account # XXXX ). These late payments appear to be reported in error, as the account is marked as Current across all bureaus and there is no valid evidence to support these entries. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 
Details of Dispute : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Late Payment Entries : o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o Experian : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With Discrepancies Additional Inaccuracies and Issues 1. Future Reporting Dates : o XXXX and Experian : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting dates in the future violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements. 
2. Payment History Discrepancies : o XXXX and XXXX : Show several months with " XXXX late payments ''. 
o Experian : Shows no similar late payment entries. 
o If the account is listed as " Current, '' there should be no late payments reported. 

3. Comments Conflicts : o XXXX and Experian : State " Consumer Statement Item in Dispute by Consumer. '' o XXXX : States " Consumer disputes - reinvestigation in progress. '' o These conflicting comments indicate unresolved or inconsistent handling of disputes. 
4. Number of Months ( Terms ) Inconsistency : o XXXX and Experian : Show 564 months. 
o XXXX : Shows 0 months, which is inaccurate or incomplete. 
5. High Credit vs. Balance : o Balance : {$480000.00}.

o High Credit : {$500000.00}.

o The balance does not exceed the high credit, but it requires proper documentation to ensure accuracy. 
6. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing. 
o Date of Last Payment : XXXX and XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : Missing. 



Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. The reporting of late payments on a current account fails to meet this standard.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report and demand a thorough reinvestigation.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the information can not be verified as accurate, it must be deleted promptly.

CFPB Standards : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau mandates that credit bureaus and furnishers maintain fair and accurate reporting practices.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment entries on my credit report regarding my account with XXXX XXXX  ( Account # XXXX ). These late payments appear to be reported in error, as the account is marked as Current across all bureaus and there is no valid evidence to support these entries. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 
Details of Dispute : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Disputed Late Payment Entries : o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o Experian : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With Discrepancies Additional Inaccuracies and Issues XXXX. Future Reporting Dates : o XXXX and Experian : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXXXXXX 
o XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting dates in the future violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements. 
XXXX. Payment History Discrepancies : o XXXX and XXXX : Show several months with " 30/60/90-day late payments ''. 
o Experian : Shows no similar late payment entries. 
o If the account is listed as " Current, '' there should be no late payments reported. 

XXXX. Comments Conflicts : o XXXX and Experian : State " Consumer Statement Item in Dispute by Consumer. '' o XXXX : States " Consumer disputes - reinvestigation in progress. '' o These conflicting comments indicate unresolved or inconsistent handling of disputes. 
XXXX. Number of Months ( Terms ) Inconsistency : o XXXX and Experian : Show XXXX  months. 
o XXXX : Shows 0 months, which is inaccurate or incomplete. 
XXXX. High Credit vs. Balance : o Balance : {$480000.00}. 
o High Credit : {$500000.00}. 
o The balance does not exceed the high credit, but it requires proper documentation to ensure accuracy. 
XXXX. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing. 
o Date of Last Payment : XXXX and XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : Missing. 



Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. The reporting of late payments on a current account fails to meet this standard.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report and demand a thorough reinvestigation.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the information can not be verified as accurate, it must be deleted promptly.

CFPB Standards : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau mandates that credit bureaus and furnishers maintain fair and accurate reporting practices.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have requested a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information reported on my consumer report pertaining to a public record. The response I received from the results was that the public record has been verified. The original furnisher, US bankruptcy court sent me a letter stating that they do not verify or report to credit agency. Just because something is public record does not mean the credit bureau is allowed to report it, they must first verify it. The credit bureau is not lawfully and accurately investigating my dispute. The research they are doing is based on assumption of names and addresses from years past and with people with similar names. People with the same name and same address could be a different person. There are many people with the same names and date of birth. Social security numbers are redacted by law and so are many other personal information due to FCRA privacy rights. This public record is unverifiable and needs to be deleted. Please see attached document from the court.

Following the data breach, I reviewed my credit report and identified accounts that I did not open or authorize. In response, I submitted a written request to the credit bureaus, pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to validate the debts associated with these accounts. However, I have not received adequate documentation or validation confirming the legitimacy of these accounts.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX  XXXX XXXX Inaccuracies and Issues 1. Account Type and Description Discrepancy : o XXXX : " Business Credit Card. '' o Experian : " XXXX Account. '' o This inconsistency in account type descriptions raises concerns about data accuracy. 
2. High Credit and Credit Limit Discrepancies : o High Credit : {$3200.00} ( consistent across reports ). 
o Credit Limit : {$3000.00} ( XXXX and XXXX ). 
o Past Due Balance : {$3600.00}. 
o The past due balance exceeds the high credit and credit limit, which is an anomaly requiring verification. 
3. Comments Conflict : o XXXX : " Charged off as bad debt. Dispute resolved ; reported by grantor. '' o Experian : " Unpaid balance reported as a loss by the credit grantor. '' o XXXX : " CONSUMER STATEMENT ITEM IN DISPUTE BY CONSUMER. '' o These comments reflect inconsistent handling of disputes and charge-offs. 

4. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Date of Last Payment : XXXX and XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o These inconsistencies should be clarified and corrected. 
5. Payment History Errors : o The Two-Year Payment History shows " CO '' ( Charge Off ) consistently across all bureaus. If this account was disputed or resolved, these entries should reflect the resolution accurately. 


XXXX  XXXX XXXX Inaccuracies and Issues 1. Balance vs. Credit Limit Conflict : o Balance : {$4100.00} ( XXXX and XXXX ). 
o Credit Limit : {$3700.00} ( all bureaus ). 
o The balance exceeds the credit limit, which is an anomaly that needs verification. 
2. Comments Discrepancies : o XXXX : " Charged off as bad debt. Dispute resolved : reported by grantor. '' o Experian : " Account was in dispute, now resolved - reported by subscriber. '' o XXXX : " CONSUMER STATEMENT ITEM IN DISPUTE BY CONSUMER. '' o Comments lack consistency regarding the resolution status and how the dispute was handled. 
3. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Date of Last Payment : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o There is a slight discrepancy in the " Date Last Active '' between XXXX and Experian. 
4. Future Reporting Dates : o Last Reported : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting future dates violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements.

5. Payment History Inconsistencies : o The Two-Year Payment History shows continuous " CO '' ( Charge Off ) statuses. If the account dispute was resolved, these entries should reflect the resolution XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Key Inaccuracies and Issues : 1. Balance Exceeding Credit Limit : o Balance : {$7800.00}.

o Credit Limit : {$7100.00}. 
o The balance exceeds the credit limit, which is inconsistent with standard account reporting practices and needs verification. 
2. Comments Discrepancies : o XXXX : " Charged off as bad debt. Account information disputed by consumer, meets FCRA requirements. '' o Experian : " Customer disputed account - reported by subscriber. Unpaid balance reported as a loss by the credit grantor. '' o XXXX : " CONSUMER STATEMENT ITEM IN DISPUTE BY CONSUMER. '' o These comments vary significantly and do not provide a clear resolution status. 
3. Future Reporting Dates : o Last Reported : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting future dates violates the FCRA 's accuracy requirements.

4. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Experian : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Date of Last Payment : All bureaus : XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Discrepancies in the " Date Last Active '' should be clarified. 
5. Payment History Errors : o The Two-Year Payment History shows " CO '' ( Charge Off ) consistently for all months. If the account was disputed or resolved, the history should reflect this. 


1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX  Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Missing and Inaccurate Account Information Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Experian for failing to provide complete and accurate information regarding my credit report for account XXXX. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX  and XX/XX/XXXX  ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the inaccuracies persist. 
FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The absence of detailed reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. 
Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case. 
Reporting incomplete information violates 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, which prohibits the omission of essential data regarding accounts. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : Missing account details such as balances, high credit limit, and payment history. 
No reported late payments ; however, the omission of critical account information creates inconsistencies in my credit profile. 
Impact on Creditworthiness : The lack of comprehensive and accurate information in my XXXX report has created discrepancies across credit bureaus, undermining my creditworthiness and leading to financial harm. 
Desired Resolution : Immediate inclusion of all relevant account details in my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the updates. 
Assurance that the reporting will be accurate and consistent moving forward. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies such as the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB XXXX Experian LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fraudulent Intent to Misrepresent Creditworthiness To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as an escalation of my previous disputes and formal demand to Experian for immediate compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), codified at 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., as well as other federal laws that mandate accuracy, transparency, and fairness in consumer credit reporting.

Despite my submission of the required documentation, including the FTC Fraud Affidavit, drivers license, and proof of address, Experian has failed to remove the unauthorized accounts listed below from my consumer credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have both complied with my disputes and removed unauthorized accounts, yet Experian continues to willfully neglect federal law, thereby displaying fraudulent intent to harm my creditworthiness and financial reputation. 

Experians back-office team has demonstrated a shocking level of inconsistency and outright negligence in their handling of my disputes. While you were able to remove all XXXX accounts within four business daysproving that you are fully capable of complying with federal law when it suits your interestsyou have willfully failed to do the same for the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  This deliberate disregard for the law and my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) highlights not only your incompetence but also a blatant fraudulent intent to misrepresent my creditworthiness. Such selective compliance exposes the predatory practices of your back-office team, who seem more concerned with protecting financial institutions than fulfilling your legal duty to consumers. If you can act swiftly in one instance, your failure to do so here is nothing but a calculated decision to inflict financial harm for profit, which raises serious questions of racketeering and profiteering off my personal and financial distress.

Violations of Federal Law 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Failure to Maintain Reasonable Procedures for Accuracy Experian is legally required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum accuracy in the reporting of consumer information. The continued inclusion of unauthorized and fraudulent accounts on my credit report, despite receiving sufficient documentation, is a gross violation of this obligation. 
2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Failure to Conduct a Proper Reinvestigation You have failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of my disputes, despite being provided with clear evidence that these accounts are unauthorized. Federal law mandates that reinvestigations must be completed within 30 days. Your blatant disregard of this statutory duty constitutes willful non-compliance.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ) Reporting Without a Permissible Purpose By continuing to report fraudulent accounts without my consent, Experian is disseminating inaccurate information to third parties without a permissible purpose, in direct violation of federal law.

4. RICO Violations Profiteering from Financial Harm Your refusal to remove these unauthorized accounts and your delay in resolving this matter further demonstrates fraudulent intent under the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act ( RICO ). By knowingly disseminating false information, you are profiting from the harm caused to my financial standing, including higher interest rates, reduced credit opportunities, and reputational damage.

5. Fraudulent Misrepresentation of Creditworthiness Experians back-office leadership has willfully ignored its duty to address and resolve this matter. This pattern of negligence and fraudulent misrepresentation is designed to benefit financially at my expense. Your actions violate my constitutional rights and cause demonstrable harm to my financial health. 
Supporting Precedent Experians refusal to comply mirrors a history of systemic non-compliance as evidenced in : FTC v. Experian Information Solutions , Inc. ( XXXX ) Highlighting Experians negligence in providing accurate information to consumers. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Demonstrating how credit reporting agencies fail to follow reasonable procedures, resulting in consumer harm. 
Your actionsor lack thereofare indicative of Experians pattern of disregarding federal law and consumer protections. 
Immediate Demands I am granting Experian one final opportunity to comply with federal law by taking the following actions within 15 days of receipt of this letter : 1. Immediately and permanently delete the following unauthorized accounts from my consumer report XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Provide written confirmation of the removal of these accounts and a detailed explanation of how Experian will ensure compliance moving forward.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Formal Demand to Remove Inaccurate XXXX XXXX  Account from Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my third and final demand that you immediately remove the inaccurate child support account information from my credit report. I have previously notified you of the inaccuracies, yet no corrective action has been taken. This ongoing violation of federal law demonstrates negligence and disregard for your legal responsibilities. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, you are legally obligated to ensure that all information you report is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : 1 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information they report. 
2 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) : Upon notice of a dispute, you are required to conduct a prompt and thorough reinvestigation to verify or remove the contested information. 
3 15 U.S.C. 1681n : Noncompliance with the FCRA subjects you to civil liability, including actual damages, statutory damages of {$1000.00} per violation, punitive damages, and attorney fees. 
In addition to your violations of the FCRA, multiple court rulings have affirmed the illegality of reporting inaccurate or unverified child support accounts to credit bureaus : XXXX XXXX XXXX United States ( XXXX ) : The court ruled that the federal government wrongfully reported XXXX XXXX arrears to credit bureaus and ordered the records expunged. 
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The court found that the XXXX XXXX agency violated the paying parents due process rights by reporting arrears without proper notice. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The court reversed a decision to report XXXX XXXX arrears due to a lack of evidence and improper procedures. 

I have solid evidence that the XXXX XXXX account information you are reporting is false and was provided without proper verification or notice. I have never provided my consent for this account to be reported, which is an additional violation of my rights. 

As a result of your continued failure to comply with federal law, I have suffered significant harm, including financial damages and emotional distress. Therefore, I am demanding : 1 Immediate removal of the inaccurate XXXX XXXX  account from my credit report. 
2 Payment of {$1000.00} in statutory damages per bureau for failing to comply with the FCRA, payable to me at the address listed above. 

If you fail to comply with this demand, I will have no choice but to initiate litigation against all three credit bureaus for willful violations of the FCRA and associated damages. In court, I will seek the maximum allowable damages, including statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorney fees. 

This is your final notice. I strongly urge you to take this matter seriously and fulfill your legal obligations. Contact me via email only. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Contact via email only XXXX All rights reserved

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments on Student Loan Account To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed regarding the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my student loan account by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) across the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) XXXX This is the second formal dispute, as my first dispute, filed on XX/XX/XXXX, failed to yield any corrective action. 
Summary of Errors : Different Account Numbers : The account numbers reported by XXXX and Experian do not match, causing further inconsistencies. 
Inconsistent Account Rating : XXXX reports the account as " Closed, '' while Experian lists it as " Paid. '' Missing Closing Date : Experian has not provided a closing date for the account, making it unclear when the account was finalized. 
Inconsistent Creditor Remarks : XXXX includes remarks indicating the account is " Closed, '' while Experian does not provide any such remarks, adding to the lack of clarity and accuracy. 
These discrepancies, along with the erroneous late payment entries, highlight a significant failure to ensure accurate reporting and adherence to federal regulations. 
Evidence of Error : The reported late payments on this account for the following months are inaccurate and unsupported : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX These payments were either made on time or the account was in deferment during these periods, as documented by my records from the US Department of Education. Despite submitting evidence of deferment status and timely payments in my first dispute, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected. 
Violations of My Consumer Rights : 1. Unauthorized Reporting and Privacy Violation : Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my financial information. The US Department of Educations reporting of this account without a permissible purpose is a violation of my rights. Furthermore, 15 USC 6801 mandates the protection of my personal financial data, which has been breached by reporting erroneous late payments.

2. Willful Noncompliance : The failure to correct these inaccuracies despite documented proof provided in my first dispute constitutes willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n, entitling me to damages.

3. Defamation and Emotional Distress : The erroneous reporting has caused significant harm to my reputation and mental well-being, amounting to defamation. 
Requested Action : I request the immediate correction of the following : Removal of all late payments reported for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Updates to reflect the accurate deferment status during these periods. 
Written confirmation that these corrections have been made. 
Failure to resolve this issue within 10 calendar days will result in further escalation, including potential legal action and additional complaints to relevant authorities. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The information listed below is a result of identity theft and is fraudulent. I have never authorized, or opened the accounts listed. This information is frivolous. I request an investigation into fraudulent activities related with my SSN and personal information. Pursuant to the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611 ) ; Formal Request for Information : I am formally requesting the names and business addresses of each individual or entity you communicated with for verification purposes in relation to the fraudulent transactions identified in my credit report. This request aligns with my right to follow up on the information provided and to assist in this identity theft investigation. Attached is a copy of my government-issued identification and a copy of the identity theft report. I am requesting these fraudulent items removed immediately from my credit files. 
Fraudulent Account : XXXX XXXX : Account # XXXX : Balance : {$1300.00} Fraudulent Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX : Account # XXXX : Balance : {$890.00} Fraudulent Account : State Employees : Account # XXXX : Balance : {$4200.00} Fraudulent Account : XXXX XXXX  : Account # XXXX : Balance : {$4700.00} Fraudulent Account : XXXX XXXX  : Account # XXXX : Balance : {$4400.00} It is unacceptable, and a violation of federal consumer protection laws, that I continue to face harassment and fictitious debts due to the unauthorized account and unauthorized inquiries. Your agency failure to delete these fraudulent entries will be direct violation of my rights under FCRA Section 605B ( 15 USC 1681c-2 ) ( a ). The FCRA requires immediate removal of fraudulent information from credit reports following a valid identity theft report, which I have provided. Such inaction is further aggravating the distress caused by this identity theft. There has been no legal proof of the marks has been provided or proven. I have reported the theft of my identity to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and have enclosed copies of the supporting documents, including the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit & Other documents. This unauthorized reporting has negatively impacted my credit standing. I respectfully request that the FTC, FDIC, & CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action to ensure that the erroneous and derogatory information is removed from my credit report. I am also pursuing complaints at federal levels to address these violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute Regarding Reporting of Late Payments and Permissible Purpose Dear [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ], I am writing to formally dispute certain entries on my credit report that indicate late payments. Specifically, I question whether the entity reporting these late payments had a permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as codified in 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( b ), to access and report this information.

Under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( b ), a consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only under specific circumstances that constitute a permissible purpose. These purposes include, but are not limited to, transactions initiated by the consumer, employment considerations, or other legitimate needs as defined by law. If the entity reporting these late payments accessed or shared my information outside these parameters, they may have violated federal law.

The late payments in question are associated with the following account ( s ) : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date ( s ) of Late Payment ( s ) : XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX I request that you investigate this matter promptly. Please verify whether the reporting entity had a permissible purpose to access and furnish this information and provide me with documentation supporting their compliance with the FCRA. If the reporting can not be verified or is found to lack a permissible purpose, I demand that these entries be deleted from my credit report immediately.

Furthermore, I request that you notify me of the results of your investigation, as well as any changes made to my credit report, within the time frame prescribed by law.

For your reference, I have attached a copy of my credit report highlighting the disputed entries, along with copies of relevant supporting documentation, including proof of identity.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments on Student Loan Account To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed regarding the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my student loan account by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) across the three major credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) XXXX This is the second formal dispute, as my first dispute, filed on XX/XX/XXXX, failed to yield any corrective action. 
Summary of Errors : Different Account Numbers : The account numbers reported by XXXX and Experian do not match, causing further inconsistencies. 
Inconsistent Account Rating : XXXX reports the account as " Closed, '' while Experian lists it as " Paid. '' Missing Closing Date : Experian has not provided a closing date for the account, making it unclear when the account was finalized. 
Inconsistent Creditor Remarks : XXXX includes remarks indicating the account is " Closed, '' while Experian does not provide any such remarks, adding to the lack of clarity and accuracy. 
These discrepancies, along with the erroneous late payment entries, highlight a significant failure to ensure accurate reporting and adherence to federal regulations. 
Evidence of Error : The reported late payments on this account for the following months are inaccurate and unsupported : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX These payments were either made on time or the account was in deferment during these periods, as documented by my records from the US Department of Education. Despite submitting evidence of deferment status and timely payments in my first dispute, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected. 
Violations of My Consumer Rights : 1. Unauthorized Reporting and Privacy Violation : Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my financial information. The US Department of Educations reporting of this account without a permissible purpose is a violation of my rights. Furthermore, 15 USC 6801 mandates the protection of my personal financial data, which has been breached by reporting erroneous late payments. 
2. Willful Noncompliance : The failure to correct these inaccuracies despite documented proof provided in my first dispute constitutes willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n, entitling me to damages.

3. Defamation and Emotional Distress : The erroneous reporting has caused significant harm to my reputation and mental well-being, amounting to defamation. 
Requested Action : I request the immediate correction of the following : Removal of all late payments reported for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Updates to reflect the accurate deferment status during these periods. 
Written confirmation that these corrections have been made. 
Failure to resolve this issue within 10 calendar days will result in further escalation, including potential legal action and additional complaints to relevant authorities. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Last 4 of social : XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Attn : Customer Relations Department Re : Request to describe method of verification To Whom It May Concern : I was in the process of applying for new employment and it was brought to my attention that there is some inaccurate information reporting on my credit report.l received a copy of my credit report and to my surprise I saw all these inaccurate items that are not correct. By the way I hope that this does not hinder my ability to obtain employment due to this inaccurate information showing. I was advised by a legal friend of mine that under 15 US Code 1681a section 603 ( k ) ( b ) ( ii ) can be considered an adverse action. 
Therefore I want the following accounts to be updated to the correct amount, date, status, open and closed date, last date of activity and time. 
If you can not complete this request, please delete the accounts immediately. I have provided an exhibit of evidence showing the inaccuracies of my reports. 
Please investigate if every piece of information is correct. If not, please remove it from my credit report. 

Re : 1. 15 U.S. CODE 1681I - PROCEDURE IN CASE OF DISPUTED ACCURACY XXXX  Account Number : XXXX UPDATE TO OPEN AND NEVER LATE 2. 15 U.S. CODE 1681I - PROCEDURE IN CASE OF DISPUTED ACCURACY XXXX  Account Number : XXXX PAID CLOSED NEVER LATE I was also wondering if you were familiar with something called 15 U.S.C. Sec.

1681i ( a )? I heard that if you can't provide proof, then these accounts must be deleted. If you are not able to update as per requested I expect all the accounts deleted immediately. 
It is also to my understanding that I am entitled to an updated credit report as well as anyone who has inquired to obtain my credit report in the last 6 months. Please send me a copy of the updated report to the address I have provided. 
Also, send a copy of the updated report to all who inquired on my credit in the last 6 months. 
Lastly, you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), and I am keeping careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to E-OSCAR or any means of automated verification. 
Thank You, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Experian for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year> ), no changes have been made to resolve this issue, in violation of both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the errors remain on my credit report. 
FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. 
15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. This obligation has not been upheld in my case. 
TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act requires creditors to provide accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The incorrect reporting of late payments has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The reported late payments for this account are inconsistent and inaccurate across different months and reporting periods. Specific discrepancies include : Late payments reported for months where no late payments occurred. 
Different late payment statuses reported across credit bureaus. 
Dates of delinquency that do not align with the accounts actual payment history. 
These errors significantly misrepresent my credit history and have negatively impacted my creditworthiness. 
Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies. 
I look forward to your prompt response to this matter. Please send confirmation of the corrections to the address provided above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

I am filing this complaint regarding Navy Federal Credit Union 's improper handling of unauthorized charges totaling {$8600.00} on my credit card XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, unauthorized charges were made on my card. I have provided Navy Federal with extensive documentation proving I could not have made these charges, including : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 4. Written fraud claim documentation 5. Navy Federal 's Written Statement of Forgery form Despite this clear evidence of my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to make these charges, Navy Federal denied my claim on XX/XX/year>. This denial violates my rights under the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1643 ), which : - Limits my liability for unauthorized charges to {$50.00} - Places the burden of proof on Navy Federal to prove authorization - Requires the credit union to conduct a reasonable investigation Navy Federal has failed to explain how these charges could be authorized when hospital records prove I was physically incapacitated during the transactions. This has caused significant financial hardship and emotional distress during an already challenging medical situation. 

I am requesting : 1. Full reimbursement of the unauthorized charges ( {$8600.00} ) 2. Removal of all related fees and interest 3. Correction of any negative credit reporting 4. Written explanation of their investigation findings

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information.

Consumer complaint narrative: Over 1 month ago I asked if I could close my bank account over the phone instead of going inside the branch. They said yes. During the closing of the account, however I had been mistakingly auto debited for my car payment ( even though it was already taken out of another account, so I was dinged twice ), so I requested a stop payment on this item. I also requested a stop payment on an unauthorized charge from a doctor ( for {$300.00} ). They told me it would take a little while for the stop payments to go through and then the account would close. After several weeks of my account still being open, I went into the branch and asked if I could please withdraw my money from the account. The teller was told by BOA that I could if they reopened my account again from its closing status, and then close it again. After trying to do this BOA on the phone ( fraud dept ) said no, we can not do this for you because its in a closed status. I asked how long until the account would close since they originally told me 10 business days and it had now been 3 full weeks. She said she did not know but it would be the end of that week. This was 2 weeks ago. My account is still open, it still shows a balance of {$450.00} and I have not received my check for the funds in my account. I need my money back now!!! No one can give me any date as to when I will receive my money back. Please help or I will be getting my lawyer involved.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Nevada XXXX Ordered a air fryer via XXXX Order number XXXX Total price - {$54.00} Says delivered XX/XX/24 @ XXXX XXXX  Ive been trying to contact XXXX for almost a week now because I wasnt home for the whole week of XX/XX/24. Upon returning to my place, there was nothing. I asked my neighbors and the building management if they or if they know anyone that received anything for me. Everyone that I asked, their reply was no. XXXX tracking doesnt state the name of the shipper. The only thing that it says is delivered XXXX @ XXXX XXXX. Last time I checked XXXX XXXX is a pretty big place. No signature verification. Im not aware if a picture was taken by the shipping company but the last time I checked in this country, when anyone buys anything online, a direct withdrawal of funds is taken. I never understand when a shipper takes a picture of any package in front of your door because when I pay in a store, as soon as I give payment, the item/s that are bought by myself are given to me in my hand in exchange for funds. Am I mistaken that when I buy anything online, it is the responsibility of whoever I buy from and the shipping company to get the items in my hands? A picture is a picture but it doesnt prove that I received any product that I paid for. In addition mistakes happen and when you dont get the items in my hands, how can you, me or anyone else be sure without a shadow of a doubt that the item/s were delivered to the correct address. How can you, I or anyone else be sure without a shadow of a doubt that the item/s werent stolen from my front door? Nothing can be without a shadow of a doubt. What is without a shadow of a doubt is that I never received the air fryer that I ordered. I am also aware that it is the week of XXXX but totally ignoring a consumer as XXXX is doing is unacceptable. Being XXXX is just ignoring me, I was forced to buy the airfryer in person and therefore want a full refund for the card used for the purchase. I want to thank you in advance for your help.

This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$190.00}, XXXX with a balance of {$15000.00}, XXXX XXXX  with a balance of {$5700.00}, XXXX with a balance of {$6100.00}, XXXX  XXXX with a balance of {$340.00}, XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$920.00}, XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$1500.00}, XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$1100.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX balance of {$1300.00}, XXXX  XXXX with a balance of {$510.00}, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$1000.00}, and XXXX XXXX XXXX with a balance of {$1000.00}. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Apparently, XXXX XXXX XXXX opened a credit card account in my name without properly verifying the actual applicant. I don't recall how I actually became aware of the account a couple of years ago ( likely I saw a credit report ). I contacted XXXX when I became aware of the account and well after it was in default. XXXX confirmed over the phone that it did not have my correct contact information in its records until I reached out to them to let them know that I never opened any account with them. XXXX however refuses to correct its error that it should not have opened the account to begin with. I called XXXX several times and also wrote them a couple of letters explaining everything to them, but they refuse to change anything. XXXX has continued to damage my credit by reporting the account as mine, which became delinquent which they eventually wrote-off. 

XXXX was completely negligent in how it issued the credit card. If it had bothered to confirm an email address or confirm a phone number, it would have known it had incorrect information, or at least have some way to trace who really opened the account. How it is possible a card issuer would not bother to at least verify contact information for someone applying for credit? And why is such a high burden placed on an innocent party to correct a card issuer 's mistake? There don't seem to be any consequences to XXXX for its negligence or unwillingness to correct its mistake, but I suffer the consequences of destroyed credit. 

After trying to get XXXX to correct the error, I reached out the credit reporting services to see if they could correct the reporting. XXXX " investigated '' and somehow " verified as accurate '' the debt, but it would be impossible to confirm that it is my debt because it is not mine. ( My appeal was received the same letter in response. The " Adverse '' information of the delinquency will remain on XXXX 's reporting until XX/XX/XXXX unless some action is taken. ) As part of the XXXX XXXX, I noticed another credit card account with XXXX  XXXX that I had been completely unaware of. When I called XXXX, they were unable to find any record of any account in my name or with my SS #. When I asked how is possible then that a delinquent account from XXXX would show up as " Adverse Information '' on my credit report, the rep did not have an answer. The XXXX rep on the phone seemed like she would be taking action to correct the problem, but I don't know what is happening. ( I only discovered the XXXX account issue this week even though the account was opened in XXXX. My credit report shows the negative information will not be removed until XX/XX/XXXX unless something is done. ) In XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an Identity Theft statement with the FTC and sent it to XXXX and XXXX. I spoke with XXXX again by phone earlier this week, provided all the information again, but nothing has changed. The representative suggested I file a complaint with the CFPB, which is what I am doing now. 

I am guessing my name an SS # were part of a data leak ( likely through the Government Personnel Office who did a background check on me and whose data breach was massive is widely known ). Whatever the source, data leaks are extremely common and credit issuers should know this and take basic steps to confirm someone's identity before issuing credit ( the CFPB did more to confirm my contact information to use this website than the credit card issuers did for whoever opened these accounts in my name. ) In a more just world, the burden would not be placed on the victims to correct the problems that occur through credit card companies being negligent in their processes. In an even more just world there would be fines or class action suits for all the harm they cause by doing this. I am sure I am not the only one whose credit has been ruined by these bogus accounts. Despite my excellent record on my actual credit accounts, these relatively small fraud items are killers. I did not do anything wrong, but the burden is on me to keep calling giant and uncaring institutions, dealing with their automated replies, writing new letters in response, filing forms with the FTC and CFPB. How is this system fair? I was not in a position to prevent what the card companies did ( they could have prevented it ) but I am the one who gets screwed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have never given consent or permission to report or share any information about me. Under the Gramm-Leach-Biley Act ( 15 USC 6801-6802 ), I have not signed any consent form allowing my information to be disclosed to non-affiliated third parties, electronically or in writing. There is no legal proof supporting the accuracy of these marks, and they have not been properly verified.

There is no legally admissible evidence to verify the accuracy of what Navy Federal Credit : Opened XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> : No Account XXXX  Listed on XXXX Report XXXX XXXX is reporting {$3300.00} on my credit files, and this agency have not validated pursuant to the requirements of the FCRA. I am complaining about the impermissible access of my credit report by Navy Federal Credit, in direct violation of the FCRA. I have discovered that the Navy Federal Credit fraudulent account. I need proof of a wet signature of an application w/ Navy Federal Credit and proof this is a credit transaction ; the agency is in violation of federal laws, and I will go legal if this isnt removed. My consumer rights are being violated. Navy Federal Credit accessed my credit report without my authorization or a permissible purpose as outlined under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which regulates the legal purposes for which consumer reports can be obtained. I have been in contact with agencies via writing and have evidence on hand, expressing this does not belong to me and I am being ignored.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Reporting Inaccurate Late Payments on XXXX XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed in regard to the unlawful and inaccurate reporting practices by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) on my consumer credit report, specifically involving my XXXX XXXX accounts. Despite my initial dispute filed on XXXX, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, causing continued harm and distress. 
The following violations have occurred in relation to this reporting : 1. Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments : The XXXX XXXX accounts were incorrectly reported with late payments during a period when the accounts were in deferment status, as documented and verified by the US Department of Education ( documentation available upon request ). The accounts should reflect a current status with no late payments. Specifically, the following dates have been inaccurately reported as late payments : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Violation of Privacy and Unauthorized Reporting Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my personal financial information. Reporting these accounts with incorrect late payments without my consent constitutes a violation of my rights.

3. Failure to Maintain Accurate Reporting Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete consumer files. By continuing to report these inaccuracies after my first dispute, the credit bureaus have failed in their obligations.

Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The errors include late payments being reported for months when the accounts were in deferment. Specifically, there are instances of 90- and 120-day late payments listed on my credit reports for XXXX and Experian XXXX despite the loans being in deferment as verified by the US Department of Education . These discrepancies have severely impacted my credit score and financial reputation.

Requested Action : Given the severity of these violations and the documented deferment status of my loans, I am formally requesting the immediate correction of these accounts from my consumer reports within 10 calendar days from the receipt of this complaint. The requested corrections include removing all late payments and ensuring the accounts reflect a current status with no delinquencies. Failure to resolve this matter will result in further escalation. 
These inaccuracies have caused significant emotional distress and damage to my creditworthiness. I demand immediate corrective action to prevent further harm. I am prepared to provide additional documentation if needed. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately. 
Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report. 

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Dear XXXX  XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of the charge-off account associated with XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( Reinvestigation of Disputed Information ), and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information ), I am entitled to request and receive complete and accurate documentation to verify the accuracy and legality of this accounts reporting. Additionally, under [ Your State ] law, I am requesting proper validation of this debt. 
I would like to highlight several cases that affirm my right to dispute this information and request accurate reporting. In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), the court emphasized the duty of credit reporting agencies and furnishers to ensure the accuracy of the information reported on consumers ' credit reports. Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) reinforces the requirement that furnishers conduct proper investigations into disputes and verify the accuracy of their reporting. 
To properly validate this account, I am requesting the following : 1. Authenticated Double-Entry Accounting Records I am requesting full double-entry accounting records for the account mentioned. This should include a detailed breakdown that shows how all transactions were debited and credited, ensuring compliance with standard accounting principles. Please note that I do not wish to receive a simple list of charges or statements. I expect authenticated evidence of the debt. 
The court ruling in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) held that mere conclusory statements from debt collectors or creditors do not satisfy the validation requirement. Only authenticated and verified documentation proving the validity of the debt is acceptable. 
XXXX. Authenticated Evidence Based on [ Your State ] Law In addition to the accounting records, I require authenticated evidence, in compliance with [ Your State ] law ( specific code if available ), that you have the legal right to report and collect this debt. This includes original signed contracts or agreements that show my obligation to pay the debt and your legal right to enforce collection and report it to credit bureaus. 
Without this evidence, the continued reporting of this debt XXXX constitute a violation of both federal and state consumer protection laws. 
In XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX. XXXX XXXX. XXXX ), the court held that creditors must produce original signed documentation to prove the validity of a debt. Failing to provide this evidence XXXX result in a violation of both state and federal consumer protection laws.

3. 1099-C Form If this debt has been forgiven, canceled, or settled for less than the full balance, I am requesting a copy of the 1099-C form filed with the IRS, which is required if the amount of canceled debt exceeds {$600.00}. If you have not provided this documentation, the debt may be considered dischargeXXXX, and it should no longer be reported as owed on my credit report.

The IRS has clearly outlined the requirements for filing a 1099-C form under 26 U.S.C. 6050P, which applies when a debt of {$600.00} or more is discharged or forgiven. If you have failed to file this form, the continued reporting of this debt may be fraudulent. 
In the absence of the requested documentation and verifiable evidence, I request that you immediately delete this account from my credit report in compliance with the FCRA and [ Your State ] law. Failure to do so will result in further action, including filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), pursuing legal remedies to enforce my rights, and submitting a Suspicious Activity Report ( SAR ) to the IRS for suspicion of fraud. The SAR ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) will be filed if you continue reporting inaccurate and unverified information without providing the required documentation. 
Please respond within 30 days of receipt of this letter. I look forward to receiving the required documentation or confirmation that the account has

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Late Payments on Credit Report Dear CFPB, I am submitting this complaint regarding inaccurate late payments that are reported on my credit file maintained by Experian. I believe these late payments are erroneous and do not accurately reflect my payment history. 
Nature of the Complaint : Inaccurate Reporting : The late payments listed on my credit report for XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX are inaccurate. My payment history reflects consistent on-time payments, and I have been enrolled in autopay for this account. 
Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The inaccurate reporting of these late payments violates my rights under the FCRA ( 15 USC 1666 ( b ) ), as they misrepresent my creditworthiness. 
Potential Violation of Fair Debt Collections Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : The reporting of false late payments may also constitute a violation of the FDCPA, which protects consumers from misrepresentation regarding their accounts. 
Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : I assert that the reporting practices violate the TILA, which mandates accurate reporting of credit information. 
Additionally, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 15 U.S. Code 1681i and 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, mandates that credit reporting agencies and information furnishers correct any inaccurate or incomplete information in credit reports and ensure the maximum accuracy of information contained in consumer files. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The account reflects late payments in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, which are inaccurate. 
Payment history should reflect 100 % on-time payments. 
The discrepancies misrepresent my creditworthiness and violate consumer protection laws. 
Requested Resolution : I request that Experian conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and remove the inaccurate late payments from my credit report. I ask that all such entries be updated to reflect my true payment history of 100 % on-time payments. 
I expect to receive written documentation confirming the removal of these entries within 30 days of this complaint submission. Failure to resolve this issue may lead to further action to protect my rights as a consumer. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I currently have a mortgage loan and the bank that has managed it since XXXX is Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. Their address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ; telephones numbers : XXXX. XXXX. 

The investor who purchased the account in XXXX is XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, mailing address : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 

The point of controversy is that Shellpoint is billing me since last XX/XX/XXXX, {$2300.00} for property taxes that have allegedly not been paid. I proceeded immediately and request a certification of XXXX ( XXXX ) debt from XXXX and send it to Shellpoint by certified mail and requested that the charges be dismissed. I made multiple calls about it without having a concrete answer by XX/XX/XXXX I wrote again explaining the situation, and called them again finally they transferred me to the property tax division of the bank and speaking with them I discovered that the property number they ( Shellpoint ) have is not the same as property was assigned by XXXX XXXX  XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX by its acronym in XXXX ( XXXX ) they had a different one. 

After realizing that, I immediately went to the XXXX offices to re-confirm that the number that my certification had was in fact the correct one of the property and thus had been certified by them. once I clarified that the bank had the wrong number, I wrote to them and once again I sent them an updated certification stating that the information I have is correct one that they need to confirm within XXXX office and make the proper correction. In response to my letter, they wrote to me requesting additional time to be able to work on the case and investigate. In XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted them again, they couldn't give me a concrete answer about what they had done in XXXX they wrote and asked me again for a certification of no debt because they couldn't request it directly to the XXXX office, once again I proceeded to send them the certification required by certified mail then I called in XXXX nothing yet, called again in XX/XX/XXXX they have confirmed that they have all the documentation requested, however they can not explain why they have not processed it yet. 

The customer service representative said it will takes a little more than a week to process it, which I gave reasonable time for them to process so I just call again Tuesday, XX/XX/XXXX the customer service representative was surprised because the information had not yet been submitted, the certification was in the system, he mentioned that there was no reason why that information had not been processed. 

I was told once again that we must wait but on this occasion the customer service representative informed me and explains that he can not eliminate the charges until they ( Shellpoint ) make a refund request to XXXX and once XXXX will reimburse the money, they will drop the charges, If they do not refund the money the charge for {$2300.00} will remain. I understand that if the error was caused either by the financial institution or the XXXX, that is an issue between them to resolve, I do not have to be penalized for it or been in the middle of it. 

Since they have dragged their feet on the matter for more than a year without being able to resolve it, I sent them a letter last Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX, which I included along with the other documents as exhibits in which I inform Shellpoint that I will open an account in the state court of XXXX XXXX and from now on I will deposit the mortgage payments in that account until they finally eliminate the property tax charges that are not applicable and that Proof of this are the certifications that have been sent updated on multiple occasions. Because of this situation I had to stop sending principal payments so I could have paid off the mortgage by last XXXX.

FINAL NOTICE! I have contacted this companies that I am distressed that you have included the information below in my credit profile and that you have failed to maintainreasonable procedures in your operations to assure maximum possible accuracy in the credit reports you publish. Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. YOU ARE VIOLATING FCRA REGULATIONS and UNITED STATES of AMERICA FEDERAL LAW.

Please block and remove all information from my credit report and send me an updated copy of my credit report. 


Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act this disputed item may not appear on my credit report if it can not be supported by any evidence.

15 U.S. Code 1681n Civil liability for willful noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1681o Civil liability for negligent noncompliance and 15 U.S. Code 1692k civil liability In multiple violations and Im entitled to monetary compensation under FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 6 ) Notice of Results of Reinvestigation. ( A ) In general. A consumer reporting agency shall provide written notice to a consumer of the results of a reinvestigation under this subsection not later than 5 business days after the completion of the reinvestigation, by mail or, if authorized by the consumer for that purpose, by other means available to the agency ( B ) Contents. As part of, or in addition to, the notice under subparagraph ( A ), a consumer reporting agency shall provide to a consumer in writing before the expiration of the 5-day period referred to in subparagraph ( A ) ( I ) a statement that the reinvestigation is completed.

In accordance with the FCRA, a consumer report excludes any report solely detailing transactions or interactions between the consumer and the reporting entity. Any inclusion of late payments or derogatory statuses constitutes a clear infringement of 15 USC 1681a ( d ) ( 1 ), as this information relates to the consumers experiences.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RE : Formal Complaint Data Breach and FDCPA/FCRA Violations Dear CFPB, I am filing this formal complaint against XXXX & XXXX XXXX LVNV FUNDING LLC XXXX and PORTFOLIO RECOVERY ASSOCIATES for their involvement in reporting debts tied to my personal information, which was exposed in a data breach. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 and Section 605B, I demand that these accounts be removed immediately from my credit report. 

The following accounts are at issue : XXXX XXXX XXXX IN ( Original Creditor : XXXX ) {$920.00} ( Updated XX/XX/year> ) LVNV FUNDING LLC ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) {$1600.00} ( Updated XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. ) {$410.00} ( Updated XX/XX/year> ) These debts have been improperly reported, and my personally identifiable information ( PII ) was compromised in a data breach. According to 15 U.S.C. 1681 and Section 605B, debts resulting from fraud or identity theft must be removed immediately. The failure to address this promptly is a direct violation of federal laws designed to protect consumers like myself. 

In addition to requesting the removal of these accounts, I have sent disputes directly to the reporting agencies and demanded that IRS Form XXXX be provided for verification of any canceled, forgiven, or written-off debt. However, these agencies have continued their collection efforts and reporting practices without proper documentation. 

I request that the CFPB investigate these agencies for their violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and the negligent handling of consumer data. I urge you to ensure that these debts are removed from my credit report without delay. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report. 

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Missing and Inaccurate Account Information Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Experian for failing to provide complete and accurate information regarding my credit report for account XXXX. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/year> and XX/XX/year> ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the inaccuracies persist. 
FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The absence of detailed reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement.

Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case.

Reporting incomplete information violates 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, which prohibits the omission of essential data regarding accounts.

Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : Missing account details such as balances, high credit limit, and payment history. 
No reported late payments ; however, the omission of critical account information creates inconsistencies in my credit profile. 
Impact on Creditworthiness : The lack of comprehensive and accurate information in my XXXX report has created discrepancies across credit bureaus, undermining my creditworthiness and leading to financial harm. 
Desired Resolution : Immediate inclusion of all relevant account details in my credit report.

Written confirmation of the updates.

Assurance that the reporting will be accurate and consistent moving forward. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies such as the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/year>, a collection account from Radius Global Solutions regarding a closed T-Mobile account appeared on my XXXX credit report. I have never received any written notice from Radius Global Solutions regarding their intent to collect this debt, nor have I been contacted in any way by this company prior to its appearance on my credit report. 

I disputed the debt with XXXX and requested verification. XXXX immediately verified the debt but did not provide any information about how they conducted their verification process. 

On XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX, 2024, I contacted Radius Global Solutions directly to request verification of the debt and a written notice as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). I provided my current address and was told that I would receive the notice within XXXX business days. However, I have never received this written notice. 

On XX/XX/year>, I contacted Radius Global Solutions again in an effort to resolve the matter, as they have been " updating the balance '' on the collection account, causing it to appear as a new account on my credit report each month. I agreed to a settlement and requested written confirmation of the settlement agreement. I provided my email address and was told I would receive the confirmation within XXXX hours. To date, I have not received anything in writing from the company regarding this settlement. 

Steps Taken : I have contacted both XXXX and Radius Global Solutions multiple times to resolve this issue. 
I have requested written verification and documentation of the debt, as well as written confirmation of the settlement agreement.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Please consider this a formal request to investigate and correct the following inaccurate items on my credit report issued by your agency. These items must be removed in order to show my true credit history. I make this request pursuant to15 USC Section 1681i of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of XXXX. As required by the Act, I demand that you re-verify each of these items, and that the inaccurate items be deleted from my record. 

Item Number Company Name Account Number Comments 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 4 late payments. 


Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you have thirty ( 30 ) days from your receipt of this letter to re-verify these entries. According to this law, failure to re-verify these items within thirty ( 30 ) days constitutes reason to drop the information from my file.

Also, 15 USC Section 1681i ( d ) requires that you notify me when the items have been deleted. Under 15 USC Section 1681j, there should be no charge for this notification or for the corrected copy of my report. Finally, please send me the names and addresses of all individuals you contacted so that I may follow up with them directly. Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 

Sincerely, _______________ Name _______________ Address _______________ Town, State and Zip _______________ Social Security No _______________ Date of Birth
