I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding several unfamiliar accounts that have appeared on my credit report following my exposure in a national data breach. Despite my proactive efforts to address this matter, I have not received satisfactory assistance, and I am seeking your intervention to resolve the issue. 

Following the data breach, I reviewed my credit report and identified accounts that I did not open or authorize. In response, I submitted a written request to the credit bureaus, pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to validate the debts associated with these accounts. However, I have not received adequate documentation or validation confirming the legitimacy of these accounts.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX, while reviewing My consumer credit report, I noticed an several unauthorized accounts. On XX/XX/year>, I provided XXXX notice of these unauthorized accounts. In said notice, I requested the following information : " Provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork back to Me along with the Affidavit signed in accordance with XXXX United States Code Section 1746 within thirty days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation and proof of claim : i. Alleged Name and Address of Creditor : ii. Name on File of alleged debtor : iii. Alleged Account Number : iv. Amount of alleged debt : v. Date that this alleged debt became payable : vi. Date of original charge off or delinquency : vii. Amount paid if debt was purchased : viii. Please attach a copy of any signed agreement debtor has made with debt collector, or other verifiable proof that debtor has a contractual obligation to pay debt collector ; ix. Furnish a copy of the original promissory note/agreement redacting My social security number to prevent identity theft and state that your client named above is the holder in due course of the note agreement and will produce the original for My own and a judges inspection should there be a trial to contest these matters ; x. Produce the account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation that you are now attempting to collect ; xi. Identify by name and address all persons, corporations, associations, or any other parties having an interest in legal proceedings regarding the alleged debt ; xii. Verify as a third party debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of the alleged debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original maker of the note ; xiii. Verify you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity ; xiv. Verify you know and understand that credit card contracts are a series of continuing offers to contract and as such are non-transferable ; xv. Provide verification from the stated creditor that you are authorized to act for them ; xvi. Verify that you know and understand that contacting Me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the debt constitutes the use of interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by advancing a writing, which you know is false with the intention that others rely on the written communication to their detriment a violation of 18 United States Code Section 1341. '' I was not provided the requested information nor resolution to this matter. It is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act for XXXX to knowingly and willfully report invalid reports on My credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency generates a consumer report, it must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information related to the individual to whom the report pertains.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, following a reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any disputed information by a consumer, an item is determined to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, the consumer reporting agency must ( i ) promptly delete the disputed item from the consumer 's file, or appropriately modify the information based on the reinvestigation results; and ( ii ) promptly inform the furnisher of the information that the item has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file.

Please remove the following items from my credit report immediately : Professional XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment entries on my credit report regarding my account with XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX ). These late payments appear to be reported in error, as the account is marked as Current across all bureaus and there is no valid evidence to support these entries. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 
Details of Dispute : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Late Payment Entries : o TransUnion XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With Discrepancies Additional Inaccuracies and Issues 1. Future Reporting Dates : o TransUnion and XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting dates in the future violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements. 
XXXX. Payment History Discrepancies : o TransUnion and XXXX : Show several months with " 30/60/90-day late payments ''. 
o XXXX : Shows no similar late payment entries. 
o If the account is listed as " Current, '' there should be no late payments reported.

3. Comments Conflicts : o TransUnion and XXXX : State " Consumer Statement Item in Dispute by Consumer. '' o XXXX : States " Consumer disputes - reinvestigation in progress. '' o These conflicting comments indicate unresolved or inconsistent handling of disputes. 
4. Number of Months ( Terms ) Inconsistency : o TransUnion and XXXX : Show 564 months. 
o XXXX : Shows 0 months, which is inaccurate or incomplete. 
5. High Credit vs. Balance : o Balance : {$480000.00}. 
o High Credit : {$500000.00}. 
o The balance does not exceed the high credit, but it requires proper documentation to ensure accuracy. 
XXXX. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : XXXX. 
o Date of Last Payment : TransUnion and XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing. 



Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard. 
2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. The reporting of late payments on a current account fails to meet this standard.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report and demand a thorough reinvestigation.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the information can not be verified as accurate, it must be deleted promptly.

CFPB Standards : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau mandates that credit bureaus and furnishers maintain fair and accurate reporting practices.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

The identity of the entity/entities responsible for carrying out this verification. 
Any documentation or evidence used to support the accuracy of the disputed items. 
I am fully aware of my rights under the FCRA, and I expect full compliance with this request. If you can not provide verifiable proof for these items.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payment entries on my credit report regarding my account with XXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ). These late payments appear to be reported in error, as the account is marked as Current across all bureaus and there is no valid evidence to support these entries. This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 
Details of Dispute : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Disputed Late Payment Entries : o TransUnion XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With Discrepancies Additional Inaccuracies and Issues XXXX. XXXX XXXX Dates : o TransUnion and XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o XXXX dates in the future violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements. 
XXXX. Payment History Discrepancies : o TransUnion and XXXX : Show several months with " XXXX late payments ''. 
o XXXX : Shows no similar late payment entries. 
o If the account is listed as " XXXX, '' there should be no late payments reported. 

XXXX. Comments Conflicts : o TransUnion and XXXX : State " Consumer Statement Item in Dispute by Consumer. '' o XXXX : XXXX " Consumer disputes - reinvestigation in progress. '' o These conflicting comments indicate unresolved or inconsistent handling of disputes. 
XXXX. Number of Months ( Terms ) Inconsistency : o TransUnion and XXXX : Show 564 months. 
o XXXX : Shows 0 months, which is inaccurate or incomplete. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : o Balance : {$480000.00}. 
o XXXX XXXX : {$500000.00}. 
o The balance does not exceed the high credit, but it requires proper documentation to ensure accuracy. 
XXXX. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : TransUnion : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing. 
o Date of Last Payment : TransUnion and XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing. 



Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. The reporting of late payments on a current account fails to meet this standard.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report and demand a thorough reinvestigation.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the information can not be verified as accurate, it must be deleted promptly.

CFPB Standards : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau mandates that credit bureaus and furnishers maintain fair and accurate reporting practices.

XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payments on XXXX  XXXX Account Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate late payments reported on my credit file for the XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ). These late payments, specifically a XXXX late payment for XX/XX/XXXX and a XXXX late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, are erroneous and do not reflect my actual payment history. 
Nature of the Complaint : Inaccurate Reporting : The listed late payments are incorrect as I have consistently made my payments on time through autopay.

Violation of FCRA ( 15 USC 1681i and 1681s-2 ) : Credit reporting agencies and furnishers are required to ensure maximum accuracy in consumer files. The failur
e to correct these inaccuracies constitutes noncompliance with federal law.

Violation of FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692e ) : Reporting incorrect information about payments may qualify as deceptive or misleading practices under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act.

Violation of TILA ( 15 USC 1601 ) : The Truth in Lending Act mandates accurate reporting of credit terms and histories.

Civil Liability Under FCRA ( 15 USC 1681n and 1681o ) : Noncompliance with these provisions subjects the responsible parties to legal liabilities, including actual damages, punitive damages, and legal fees.

Summary of Discrepancies TransUnion : Reported 30-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX late payment for XX/XX/XXXX. 
These are incorrect as the account history reflects consistent payments with no delinquencies.

Requested Resolution : I request the following : Conduct a thorough investigation into the discrepancies on this account.

Remove the inaccurate late payment entries from my credit file.

Provide written confirmation of the corrections within 30 days, as required under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ).

Failure to comply with this request may result in further actions to enforce my rights as a consumer under federal law. Attached, you will find supporting documentation, including payment records and statements, to substantiate my claim. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Student loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
According to the last communication I received from XXXX after applying for the SAVE consolidation and new payment plans, communication I did receive noted that I have taken out about {XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  subsequently, have repaid {XXXX XXXX and still owe XXXX XXXX on student loands. I am aware that the SAVE plan was disabled by the courts, and that Republicans plan to repeal PSLF by recess. This is a complex issue that in my view involves predatory student loans, predatory higher education, and predatory landlords and employers. 

The inception of my student loan debt began in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Although I had excellent grades and scored in the top 1XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX because when I chose to go to college after high school, scholarship funds for non traditional students pale in comparison to graduating high school seniors. Student loan debt we were counseled was good debt. When because I was technologically savvy loved ones and career advisors counseled me to go into XXXX, and I found out XXXX had a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I enrolled. 

Although I don't have any of the printed brochures to document the same any longer, I was told ( and my mother would attest as I appealed to get independent student status at XXXX when I completed a FAFSA, and she attended two meetings with me with an program advisor and financial aid administrator ) that the program had a 90 % success rate with 90 % of graduates finding employment with XXXX XXXX corporations. Of course they didn't allow me into XXXX XXXX classes and required me to get a course of general education credits before I was able to get into my first XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, from which the initial XXXX XXXX of my student loan debt was incurred. 

In truth, 70 % of the students in my cohort dropped out of the program and were unsuccessful because its instructors were from XXXX, hardly spoke XXXX, and their accents were so thick that we could barely understand them. When we asked for clarification or for them to repeat information, they screamed at us. Thus, 70 % of us dropped, self included. They had misrepresented the program to us, and predatorily preyed upon us to get our student loan, grant, and private loan dollars ( I took no private loans ). 

I decided to pursue then XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, as I was getting wiser about the cost of higher education, but despite my asking and inquiring and being assured that all of my credits would transfer from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I wasted roughly a year of my life as after I transferred to XXXX, about half of those credits did not transfer and I had to retake the classes, requiring more debt as a non traditional student. However, to their credit, and because of state income tax in Nebraska, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  did have more scholarship money for exceptional non-traditional students such as myself which I was encouraged to apply for by my professors, which I did, and I was awarded a full-ride ( no living stipend ) to XXXX. During this time, my then partner and then wife and I conceived inconveniently, and with an infant at home after XXXX, could not afford to make our ends meet at the wages we were making and moved in with her parents. It was not a savory environment in which to raise a child XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  And so while I could not turn down a full ride that had been awarded wisely, and we looked at ways to try to make our ends meet ( we were too proud to apply for public assistance ), my then wife and I decided our best move was to move to my hometown of XXXXXXXX XXXX where I had familial support for raising our infant. 

I spoke to the XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, and they assured me that while I could complete all but the last year of my education in XXXX accurately, they deceived us in response to my questions about whether there would be adequate course selection and availability for me to get a full time schedule together. Of course before moving home to XXXXXXXX XXXX to continue my education through XXXX XXXX and the XXXX XXXX XXXX, I applied for and was admitted to the XXXX XXXX XXXX Upon being admitted, I spoke to the XXXX XXXX XXXX  and my initial conversation by phone with the admissions counselor with whom I conversed to gain admission, and faxed them a copy of my full ride scholarship award letter ( which I still do have, even if I do not have documentation of my having faxed it to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) from the XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX, asking if they would match the scholarship. The admissions counselor promised me that they would match my full-ride scholarship if I earned straight As ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

After I did earn straight As, I contacted the admissions office and then spoke to XXXX XXXX who was then the head of the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and after investigation she apologized but told me that the admissions counselor had misled me and awarded resident instead of non-resident tuition and that was the best that they could do. I should have consulted an attorney, and I'm currently investigating the same here. 

After a single year at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I found that I struggled to hobble together even XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX required for a XXXX XXXX XXXX, thus necessitating a move to XXXX XXXX to complete my education. The entire reason we moved home was to have familial support in XXXXXXXX XXXX where my family lived, but now we found that we'd have to move to XXXXXXXX XXXX, where we had no familial support which vastly contributed to the failure of my marriage and ultimately in XXXX would leave me a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

The waiting list for married student housing was two years long, so the only way that we could practically continue our XXXX XXXX was by living off-campus. The employers and landlords in XXXXXXXX XXXX  in my view similarly exploit the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX population through low wages and high rents. The only way we could make our ends meet, even with public assistance in the form of foodstamps, Title XIX Medicaid, and childcare assistance, was through student loans and using debt as income to pay for our living expenses. Thus, the remainder of my student loan debt balance were the result of two predatory higher education institutions and perverse incentives that existed for admissions counselors and program representatives ( I later discovered the same was due to quota systems and commissions paid ) to profiteer from higher education, and similar federal predatory student loans. 

On this basis, I submitted two Borrower 's Defense Program applicaitons in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which are still just showing " pending. '' I also did register for and was accepted for, and have been credited under XXXX XXXX for six years of on-time payments, and was chagrined first to apply for consolidation and then enrollment in the new SAVE Plans to see that the courts have halted the same, and have requested information about what to do. I'm more chagrined to see the Republican plan is to repeal PSLF using recess legislation, but was happy today to see that Biden has moved to forgive PSLF loans, and I pray that my loans, given my Borrower 's Defense complaints, are among those being forgiven. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, but due to the bias in the court system against fathers, and despite her then interest in terminating her parenting rights, and admission, even in her divorce complaint that I should be awarded primary custody, she knew the odds were stacked against me and the price I had to pay for her was to accept the largess of the student loan debt we'd taken out under my name to pay for those living expenses. What would have been fair would have been for us to have deducted each of our fees and tuition from our loan totals, and split it down the middle but because XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  and working part time, and she, the opposite, I qualified for more in loans than she did, and so while we both maxxed out our loans the majority of the debt that we incurred in XXXXXXXX XXXX, was under my name. But to get my son XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the price I paid was to accept all of the debt that resulted. 

Thus, I'm hoping by filing this complaint given my multiple attempts over the last three years, and the change in administrations, and plans of Republicans ot repeal PSLF and Borrower 's Defense not by act of Congress through normal processes but by recess legislation, that you could assist me in getting my Borrower 's Defense applications XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX prioritized or escalated before XX/XX/XXXX. Further, I would humbly request if there is anything that can be done legally to preserve my claims given the change in administration and promised actions by Republicans or ensure they can be grandfathered, I've been reading in forums that if they haven't investigated within 3 years, that loans are automatically discharged to somehow extend their investigation to XXXX XXXX XXXX so that they are. 
Can you help in prioritizing or escalating my Borrower 's Defense complaints to FedAid Borrower 's Defense administrators and/or Sec of Education Sec XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to possibly getting my loans forgiven or at least a portion of them forgiven given the court halt of the SAVE plan under the recent orders for PSLF forgiveness under President Biden, and include my loans in that action?

My current student loans were in the process of being consolidated first from XXXX XXXX XXXX then to Mohela and then back to FedStudent Aid for consolidation under the SAVE plan halted by the courts. Further, I had previously had my loans consolidated at 3 % and in applying for the save plan, they were consolidated at higher interest rates ( the SAVE direct unsubsidized consolidation loan for {$68000.00} was consolidated at 4.25 % fixed, and the saved direct subsidized consolidation loan for {$25000.00} also at 4.25 % ), so if nothing can be done that way, is there a way that the interest rates can be dropped to the prior rate they were at given the courts ' actions on SAVE Plan consolidation, and can you assist in that worst case scenario? 

According to XXXX, I have 106 payments towards 120 payments for PSLF for all loans.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX Robinhood ( robinhood.com ) placed a restriction on my account when I went to transfer the balance of my bitcoin from Robinhood and into a wallet. This is seen in the screen shot with the transaction history and the " Failed '' transfer, which was the beginning of the restriction. On the website the notification indicated that my account would be reviewed by XX/XX/XXXX. All week I continued to log in, check my balances, and see if the restriction was lifted. On the XXXX the notification asked for invasive amount of personal verification : front and back photo of my license, selfie front and sides, and a photo of a bank statement from an account from which I had originally transferred money into Robinhood. It seemed excessive and invasive, but wanting to free up my account, I complied. The on-screen prompt confirmed my documents would be reviewed for removing the restriction, again by XX/XX/XXXX. 

It's now XX/XX/XXXX and the account is STILL locked, with the error notification indicating the restriction date is moved out to XX/XX/XXXX. 

I tried calling Robinhood only to find only an automated recording directing callers back to the website chat to request a phone call, then disconnects. The website chat ( which seems to be only available on desktop ) does not provide a place to enter text, just to click on a pre-written response accepting the situation. 

Never has any bank withheld my money or asked for more than a 2-step verification top grant access. It seems more like an ongoing Hostage situation and is deeply inappropriate!

Regarding attachments- I advise anyone to take more screen shots than you think you need. I failed to when submitting the ridiculous documentation, or any confirmations from Robinhood ( If there were any, I don't remember ), or their XX/XX/year> promise, and 100 % regret missing those.

By the way I hope that this does not hinder my ability to obtain employment due to this inaccurate information showing. 3. 15 U.S. CODE 1692K - CIVIL LIABILITY XXXXXXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Please remove it from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Deletion of Unauthorized Accounts and Inquiries Pursuant to FCRA Section 604 To Whom It May Concern, I am demanding the immediate deletion of the following accounts from my credit file, as they were obtained and/or reported without permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681b ] : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Account # XXXX Section 604 of the FCRA explicitly prohibits a consumer reporting agency from furnishing a consumer report unless specific, legally permissible purposes are met. These accounts do not have my authorization, nor do they meet any of the statutory conditions outlined in Section 604 ( a ).

I have not been provided with : Any certification or evidence of permissible purpose.

Prior notification of these inquiries or accounts.

Documentation verifying their validity.

This is a formal demand for : 1.Immediate Deletion : Remove the above-listed accounts and any associated inquiries from my credit report immediately, as they were not authorized or established in compliance with the FCRA.

2.Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of the deletions within the time frame mandated by the FCRA.

Please be advised that I have filed complaints with both the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding this matter. These agencies have been informed of the unauthorized access and reporting of these accounts on my credit file.

If these unauthorized accounts are not promptly removed, I will pursue further actions to enforce my rights under the FCRA, which may include legal proceedings.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a resolution within the timeframe specified under the FCRA

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), no changes have been made to resolve this issue, in violation of both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the errors remain on my credit report. 
FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. 
15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. This obligation has not been upheld in my case. 
TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act requires creditors to provide accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The incorrect reporting of late payments has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The reported late payments for this account are inconsistent and inaccurate. Specific discrepancies include : Late payments incorrectly reported for the following months : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Dates of delinquency that do not align with the accounts actual payment history. 
Reporting errors inconsistent with records from other credit bureaus. 
These errors significantly misrepresent my credit history and have negatively impacted my creditworthiness. 
Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies. 
I look forward to your prompt response to this matter. Please send confirmation of the corrections to the address provided above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Reporting Inaccurate Late Payments on Student Loans To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed in regard to the unlawful and inaccurate reporting practices by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) on my consumer credit report, specifically involving my student loan accounts. Despite my initial dispute filed on XX/XX/XXXX, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, causing continued harm and distress. 
The following violations have occurred in relation to this reporting : 1. Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments : The student loan accounts were incorrectly reported with late payments during a period when the accounts were in deferment status, as documented and verified by the US Department of Education ( documentation available upon request ). The accounts should reflect a current status with no late payments. Specifically, the following dates have been inaccurately reported as late payments : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX. Violation of Privacy and Unauthorized Reporting Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my personal financial information. Reporting these accounts with incorrect late payments without my consent constitutes a violation of my rights.

3. Failure to Maintain Accurate Reporting Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete consumer files. By continuing to report these inaccuracies after my first dispute, the credit bureaus have failed in their obligations. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The errors include late payments being reported for months when the accounts were in deferment. Specifically, there are instances of 90- and 120-day late payments listed on my credit reports for TransUnion and XXXX , despite the loans being in deferment as verified by the US Department of Education . These discrepancies have severely impacted my credit score and financial reputation.

Requested Action : Given the severity of these violations and the documented deferment status of my loans, I am formally requesting the immediate correction of these accounts from my consumer reports within 10 calendar days from the receipt of this complaint. The requested corrections include removing all late payments and ensuring the accounts reflect a current status with no delinquencies. Failure to resolve this matter will result in further escalation. 
These inaccuracies have caused significant emotional distress and damage to my creditworthiness. I demand immediate corrective action to prevent further harm. I am prepared to provide additional documentation if needed. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Re : Urgent Request - Fraudulent information Block under Section 605B of the FCRA To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to urgently request the removal of fraudulent accounts and inquiries on my credit report due to identity theft. The inaccurate information is causing significant harm to my credit, and I expect immediate corrective action. 
Per Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), the following fraudulent accounts must be blocked and permanently removed from my credit file. I am invoking my right to have fraudulent information blocked and permanently removed from my credit report within four ( 4 ) business days from the date of receipt of this letter. 
Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX Account Name : XXXX Account XXXX Failure to comply with this request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action. If this fraudulent information is not blocked and removed, I will file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and I will seek monetary damages for the harm caused by continued reporting of these inaccuracies. 
I also demand the immediate removal of all unauthorized inquiries related to this identity theft, which were not authorized by me and have negatively impacted my credit. If these inquiries are not promptly removed, I will escalate this matter to the appropriate legal authorities. 
I expect written confirmation by 4 BUSINESS DAYS FROM THE LETTER DATE confirming that the fraudulent account and any related unauthorized inquiries have been fully removed from my credit report. 
This is a time-sensitive matter, and you are now officially on notice. Failure to act promptly will result in further legal action to protect my rights and restore my credit. 
Thank you for your immediate action to this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Transunion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX. 
Despite several requests for correction ( letters dated XXXX XXXX  ) and ( XXXX ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ).

1. FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case.

2. TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act emphasizes the necessity for accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The inaccurate reporting of late payments has caused undue harm to my creditworthiness.

3. Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act ( PAANL ) : This act reinforces the responsibility of creditors to provide timely statements, preventing unfair penalties to consumers. 
I am formally requesting that the inaccurate late payment notation be removed from my credit report immediately. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint XXXX XXXX Department of Education for Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments on Student Loan Account To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed regarding the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my student loan account by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) across the three major credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ) XXXX This is the second formal dispute, as my first dispute, filed on XX/XX/XXXX, failed to yield any corrective action. 
Summary of Errors : Different Account Numbers : The account numbers reported by TransUnion and XXXX do not match, causing further inconsistencies. 
Inconsistent Account Rating : TransUnion reports the account as " Closed, '' while XXXX lists it as " Paid. '' Missing Closing Date : XXXX has not provided a closing date for the account, making it unclear when the account was finalized. 
Inconsistent Creditor Remarks : TransUnion includes remarks indicating the account is " Closed, '' while XXXX does not provide any such remarks, adding to the lack of clarity and accuracy. 
These discrepancies, along with the erroneous late payment entries, highlight a significant failure to ensure accurate reporting and adherence to federal regulations. 
Evidence of Error : The reported late payments on this account for the following months are inaccurate and unsupported : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX These payments were either made on time or the account was in deferment during these periods, as documented by my records from the US Department of Education. Despite submitting evidence of deferment status and timely payments in my first dispute, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected. 
Violations of My Consumer Rights : 1. Unauthorized Reporting and Privacy Violation : Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my financial information. The US Department of Educations reporting of this account without a permissible purpose is a violation of my rights. Furthermore, 15 USC 6801 mandates the protection of my personal financial data, which has been breached by reporting erroneous late payments. 
2. Willful Noncompliance : The failure to correct these inaccuracies despite documented proof provided in my first dispute constitutes willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n, entitling me to damages.

3. Defamation and Emotional Distress : The erroneous reporting has caused significant harm to my reputation and mental well-being, amounting to defamation. 
Requested Action : I request the immediate correction of the following : Removal of all late payments reported for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Updates to reflect the accurate deferment status during these periods. 
Written confirmation that these corrections have been made. 
Failure to resolve this issue within 10 calendar days will result in further escalation, including potential legal action and additional complaints to relevant authorities. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative: Reference Accounts : XXXX I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report, pursuant to Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, and request the immediate removal of any fraudulent accounts associated with my name and personal information. In accordance with this law, I have provided the necessary FTC Identity Theft Report to support my claim of fraudulent activity and data breach. I recently discovered that my personal information was compromised as part of a data breach involving XXXX. As a direct result of this breach, I am now facing fraudulent collections accounts on my credit report. The unauthorized use of my personal information has led to these collections being wrongly attributed to me. Under the FCRA, specifically Section 605B, I am entitled to request the removal of these fraudulent accounts from my credit file, as they do not reflect any legitimate debt I owe. 2. Request for Immediate Removal of Fraudulent Information : Under Section 605B of the FCRA, I request that you immediately remove all accounts that were opened fraudulently or are associated with identity theft from my credit report. These accounts were not authorized by me and have been opened as a result of the data breach involving XXXX. I have included a copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report, which details the fraudulent activity and confirms the theft of my personal information. 3. Legal Timeframe for Removal : Under Section 605B of the FCRA, when a consumer submits a valid FTC Identity Theft Report, credit reporting agencies must take action to investigate and remove fraudulent accounts within 4 business days. Therefore, I request that you immediately remove these fraudulent accounts from my credit report and correct the inaccuracies. Failure to comply with this requirement will leave me no choice but to pursue further legal actions, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ). 4. Failure to Verify Fraudulent Accounts : As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), when a consumer disputes information on their credit report, the credit bureaus must conduct a reasonable investigation into the disputed items. However, I have reason to believe that the fraudulent accounts, stemming from the data breach, have not been properly investigated or removed. Despite my prior dispute, these accounts remain on my credit report, which is causing severe damage to my XXXX XXXX. 5. Request for Removal Due to Inaccuracy or Fraud : As these accounts are the result of identity theft and a data breach, I am requesting that you immediately remove them from my credit file in accordance with the FCRA. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), if information can not be verified or is found to be inaccurate or incomplete, it must be deleted. This includes accounts opened fraudulently due to a data breach. 6. FTC Report Submission : Enclosed with this letter is a copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report, which I filed to support my claim. According to the FCRA and guidelines of the Federal Trade Commission, this report serves as evidence that I have been a victim of identity theft and data breach, and it should be sufficient for the removal of fraudulent accounts from my credit report. I kindly ask that you complete your investigation and remove the fraudulent accounts from my credit report within 4 business days, as required by law. If you do not comply with the FCRA, I will escalate the matter by filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may consider pursuing further legal action. Please provide written confirmation that these fraudulent accounts have been removed and that my credit report has been updated to reflect the accurate information. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), no changes have been made to resolve this issue, in violation of both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the errors remain on my credit report. 
FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement.

15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. This obligation has not been upheld in my case.

TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act requires creditors to provide accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The incorrect reporting of late payments has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The reported late payments for this account are inconsistent and inaccurate. Specific discrepancies include : Late payments incorrectly reported for the following months : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Dates of delinquency that do not align with the accounts actual payment history. 
Reporting errors inconsistent with records from other credit bureaus. 
These errors significantly misrepresent my credit history and have negatively impacted my creditworthiness.

Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies. 
I look forward to your prompt response to this matter. Please send confirmation of the corrections to the address provided above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments on Student Loan Account To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed regarding the inaccurate reporting of late payments on my student loan account by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) across the three major credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ) XXXX This is the second formal dispute, as my first dispute, filed on XX/XX/XXXX, failed to yield any corrective action. 
Summary of Errors : Different Account Numbers : The account numbers reported by TransUnion and XXXX do not match, causing further inconsistencies. 
Inconsistent Account Rating : TransUnion reports the account as " Closed, '' while XXXX lists it as " XXXX. '' Missing Closing Date : XXXX has not provided a closing date for the account, making it unclear when the account was finalized. 
Inconsistent Creditor Remarks : TransUnion includes remarks indicating the account is " Closed, '' while XXXX does not provide any such remarks, adding to the lack of clarity and accuracy. 
These discrepancies, along with the erroneous late payment entries, highlight a significant failure to ensure accurate reporting and adherence to federal regulations. 
Evidence of Error : The reported late payments on this account for the following months are inaccurate and unsupported : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX These payments were either made on time or the account was in deferment during these periods, as documented by my records from the US Department of Education. Despite submitting evidence of deferment status and timely payments in my first dispute, the inaccuracies remain uncorrected. 
Violations of My Consumer Rights : 1. Unauthorized Reporting and Privacy Violation : Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my financial information. The US Department of Educations reporting of this account without a permissible purpose is a violation of my rights. Furthermore, 15 USC 6801 mandates the protection of my personal financial data, which has been breached by reporting erroneous late payments.

2. Willful Noncompliance : The failure to correct these inaccuracies despite documented proof provided in my first dispute constitutes willful noncompliance under 15 USC 1681n, entitling me to damages.

3. Defamation and Emotional Distress : The erroneous reporting has caused significant harm to my reputation and mental well-being, amounting to defamation. 
Requested Action : I request the immediate correction of the following : Removal of all late payments reported for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Updates to reflect the accurate deferment status during these periods. 
Written confirmation that these corrections have been made. 
Failure to resolve this issue within 10 calendar days will result in further escalation, including potential legal action and additional complaints to relevant authorities. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal demand for compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, regarding my identity theft case. I am the victim of identity theft, and fraudulent accounts, addresses, employment details, and credit inquiries have been unlawfully reported on my credit file.

Violations of FCRA : Failure to Block Information Resulting from Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Under this section, you must block any information identified as a result of identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving my dispute and required documentation. Failure to do so constitutes a violation of federal law.

Failure to Reinvestigate Disputed Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1
681i ) : If you fail to reinvestigate the disputed items within 30 days, you are in violation of this section.

If you reinstate the fraudulent information without notifying me or conducting a reasonable investigation, you may be in further violation.

Failure to Notify Data Furnishers ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Upon receiving my dispute, you must notify the furnishers of the fraudulent information within five ( 5 ) business days.

Providing Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : You have a legal duty to maintain accurate credit files. Reporting or failing to correct fraudulent information after being notified is a breach of this obligation.

Failure to Provide Results of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : After completing an investigation, you are required to provide a written notice of results and any changes made within five ( 5 ) business days.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. 

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report. 

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against US Department of Education for Reporting Inaccurate Late Payments on Student Loans To Whom It May Concern, This complaint is filed in regard to the unlawful and inaccurate reporting practices by the US Department of Education ( US DEPT ED ) on my consumer credit report, specifically involving my student loan accounts. Despite my initial dispute filed on XX/XX/XXXX, the inaccuracies remain unresolved, causing continued harm and distress. 
The following violations have occurred in relation to this reporting : 1. Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payments : The student loan accounts were incorrectly reported with late payments during a period when the accounts were in deferment status, as documented and verified by the US Department of Education ( documentation available upon request ). The accounts should reflect a current status with no late payments. Specifically, the following dates have been inaccurately reported as late payments : XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  2. Violation of Privacy and Unauthorized Reporting Under 15 USC 1681b, I retain the right to privacy regarding my personal financial information. Reporting these accounts with incorrect late payments without my consent constitutes a violation of my rights. 
3. Failure to Maintain Accurate Reporting Under 15 USC 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies are required to maintain accurate and complete consumer files. By continuing to report these inaccuracies after my first dispute, the credit bureaus have failed in their obligations. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The errors include late payments being reported for months when the accounts were in deferment. Specifically, there are instances of 90- and 120-day late payments listed on my credit reports for TransUnion and XXXX XXXX despite the loans being in deferment as verified by the US Department of Education . These discrepancies have severely impacted my credit score and financial reputation.

Requested Action : Given the severity of these violations and the documented deferment status of my loans, I am formally requesting the immediate correction of these accounts from my consumer reports within 10 calendar days from the receipt of this complaint. The requested corrections include removing all late payments and ensuring the accounts reflect a current status with no delinquencies. Failure to resolve this matter will result in further escalation. 
These inaccuracies have caused significant emotional distress and damage to my creditworthiness. I demand immediate corrective action to prevent further harm. I am prepared to provide additional documentation if needed. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), no changes have been made to resolve this issue, in violation of both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the errors remain on my credit report. 
FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement.

15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. This obligation has not been upheld in my case. 
TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act requires creditors to provide accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The incorrect reporting of late payments has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The reported late payments for this account are inconsistent and inaccurate. Specific discrepancies include : Late payments incorrectly reported for the following months : XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Dates of delinquency that do not align with the accounts actual payment history. 
Reporting errors inconsistent with records from other credit bureaus. 
These errors significantly misrepresent my credit history and have negatively impacted my creditworthiness.

Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report.

Written confirmation of the correction.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies.

I look forward to your prompt response to this matter. Please send confirmation of the corrections to the address provided above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

To my innerstanding Federal Reserve Notes, which are legal tender in the United States and are backed by full faith and credit of the United States ( unincorporated ) Lawful money is backed by gold and silver Does THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION operate under the BANKRUPTY ACT of 1933 HOUSE JOINT RESOLUTION?

Does THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION participate in T.I.L.A? 

My consumer reporting file is incorrect nor accurate According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ; The U.S. Congress enacted the Fair Credit Reporting Act in 1970 The FCRA was intended to address concerns over consumers previous inability to challenge errors in their credit reports, as well as a lack of privacy protections related to consumers credit information. 

Can they provide information on how to initiate an administrative appeal? 

How can I challenge decisions, seek clarification, or request a review of these cases/claims on my report?

Would 18 U.S. Code 2073 and 2076 False Entries and reports of moneys or securities be applicable concerning this and officer failing to make returns or reports?

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 


Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action. 


Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs. 
Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately. 
Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report. 

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Apparently, XXXX XXXX XXXX opened a credit card account in my name without properly verifying the actual applicant. I don't recall how I actually became aware of the account a couple of years ago ( likely I saw a credit report ). I contacted XXXX when I became aware of the account and well after it was in default. XXXX confirmed over the phone that it did not have my correct contact information in its records until I reached out to them to let them know that I never opened any account with them. XXXX however refuses to correct its error that it should not have opened the account to begin with. I called XXXX several times and also wrote them a couple of letters explaining everything to them, but they refuse to change anything. XXXX has continued to damage my credit by reporting the account as mine, which became delinquent which they eventually wrote-off. 

XXXX was completely negligent in how it issued the credit card. If it had bothered to confirm an email address or confirm a phone number, it would have known it had incorrect information, or at least have some way to trace who really opened the account. How it is possible a card issuer would not bother to at least verify contact information for someone applying for credit? And why is such a high burden placed on an innocent party to correct a card issuer 's mistake? There don't seem to be any consequences to XXXX for its negligence or unwillingness to correct its mistake, but I suffer the consequences of destroyed credit. 

After trying to get XXXX to correct the error, I reached out the credit reporting services to see if they could correct the reporting. TransUnion " investigated '' and somehow " verified as accurate '' the debt, but it would be impossible to confirm that it is my debt because it is not mine. ( My appeal was received the same letter in response. The " Adverse '' information of the delinquency will remain on TransUnion 's reporting until XX/XX/XXXX unless some action is taken. ) As part of the TransUnion correspondence, I noticed another credit card account with XXXX  XXXX that I had been completely unaware of. When I called XXXX, they were unable to find any record of any account in my name or with my SS #. When I asked how is possible then that a delinquent account from XXXX would show up as " Adverse Information '' on my credit report, the rep did not have an answer. The XXXX rep on the phone seemed like she would be taking action to correct the problem, but I don't know what is happening. ( I only discovered the XXXX account issue this week even though the account was opened in XXXX. My credit report shows the negative information will not be removed until XX/XX/XXXX unless something is done. ) In XX/XX/XXXX, I filed an Identity Theft statement with the FTC and sent it to TransUnion and XXXX. I spoke with TransUnion again by phone earlier this week, provided all the information again, but nothing has changed. The representative suggested I file a complaint with the CFPB, which is what I am doing now. 

I am guessing my name an SS # were part of a data leak ( likely through the Government Personnel Office who did a background check on me and whose data breach was massive is widely known ). Whatever the source, data leaks are extremely common and credit issuers should know this and take basic steps to confirm someone's identity before issuing credit ( the CFPB did more to confirm my contact information to use this website than the credit card issuers did for whoever opened these accounts in my name. ) In a more just world, the burden would not be placed on the victims to correct the problems that occur through credit card companies being negligent in their processes. In an even more just world there would be fines or class action suits for all the harm they cause by doing this. I am sure I am not the only one whose credit has been ruined by these bogus accounts. Despite my excellent record on my actual credit accounts, these relatively small fraud items are killers. I did not do anything wrong, but the burden is on me to keep calling giant and uncaring institutions, dealing with their automated replies, writing new letters in response, filing forms with the FTC and CFPB. How is this system fair? I was not in a position to prevent what the card companies did ( they could have prevented it ) but I am the one who gets screwed.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Transunion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX. 
Despite several requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> ) and ( XX/XX/year> ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
XXXX. FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case.

2. TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act emphasizes the necessity for accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The inaccurate reporting of late payments has caused undue harm to my creditworthiness. 

XXXX. Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act ( PAANL ) : This act reinforces the responsibility of creditors to provide timely statements, preventing unfair penalties to consumers. 
I am formally requesting that the inaccurate late payment notation be removed from my credit report immediately. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Immediate Deletion of Unauthorized Accounts and Inquiries Pursuant to FCRA Section 604 To Whom It May Concern, I am demanding the immediate deletion of the following accounts from my credit file, as they were obtained and/or reported without permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681b ] : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Section 604 of the FCRA explicitly prohibits a consumer reporting agency from furnishing a consumer report unless specific, legally permissible purposes are met. These accounts do not have my authorization, nor do they meet any of the statutory conditions outlined in Section 604 ( a ).

I have not been provided with : Any certification or evidence of permissible purpose.

Prior notification of these inquiries or accounts.

Documentation verifying their validity.

This is a formal demand for : 1.Immediate Deletion : Remove the above-listed accounts and any associated inquiries from my credit report immediately, as they were not authorized or established in compliance with the FCRA.

2.Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation of the deletions within the time frame mandated by the FCRA.

Please be advised that I have filed complaints with both the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding this matter. These agencies have been informed of the unauthorized access and reporting of these accounts on my credit file.

If these unauthorized accounts are not promptly removed, I will pursue further actions to enforce my rights under the FCRA, which may include legal proceedings. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a resolution within the timeframe specified under the FCRA

Failure to Conduct a Proper Investigation of Disputed Information : On XX/XX/year>, I filed a dispute with TransUnion regarding inaccuracies in my credit report. I provided clear supporting evidence, including highlighted copies of my credit report identifying the errors. However, XXXX used the E-Oscar system to process my dispute electronically rather than conducting the manual review I requested. This process fails to ensure a thorough investigation, as required under the FCRA. 
The response I received was vague and did not provide sufficient detail regarding the methods, sources, or procedures used to verify the disputed information. My specific questions about the investigation process remain unanswered.

2. Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance by a Collection Agency : 3. Despite my dispute, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report this collection account without verifying its validity or requiring the collection agency to issue a 1099-C. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation : o XXXX violated 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) by failing to conduct a manual review of my dispute as explicitly requested. o The use of E-Oscar resulted in an inadequate and incomple
te investigation.

2. Failure to Provide Details of Investigation : o XXXX failed to provide the methods, sources, and documentation used in their investigation, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 4 ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ).

3. Inaccurate Reporting and Failure to Address 1099-C Non-Issuance : o XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion continue to report inaccurate information, violating my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a complaint against Transunion for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX. 
Despite several requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year> ) and ( XX/XX/year> ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). 
XXXX. FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files, which has not been upheld in my case.

2. TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act emphasizes the necessity for accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The inaccurate reporting of late payments has caused undue harm to my creditworthiness.

3. Protection Against Non-Payment of Obligations Act ( PAANL ) : This act reinforces the responsibility of creditors to provide timely statements, preventing unfair penalties to consumers.

I am formally requesting that the inaccurate late payment notation be removed from my credit report immediately.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies.

I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!
