Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in response to your request regarding my complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX. Below is a summary of the actions I have taken and the ongoing issues with XXXX XXXX XXXX  handling of my personal information and credit reporting. 

Timeline of Events and Actions Taken : Debt Validation Letter ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent XXXX XXXX XXXX a Debt Validation letter requesting validation of the alleged debt they are attempting to collect. This is my right under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). The letter explicitly requested that XXXX XXXX XXXX provide verification of the debt, including the original creditor, the amount, and other relevant details. 
No response was received from XXXX XXXX XXXX within the required 30-day period. This lack of response is a violation of my rights under the FDCPA, which mandates that they must provide this validation before continuing any collection activities. 
Cease and Desist Letter ( XX/XX/XXXX ) : On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a Cease and Desist letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX, demanding that they immediately stop accessing or reporting my personal information to credit bureaus without my consent. 
This letter also reiterated my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), which requires consumer consent before any third party can access or report my credit information. I have not given XXXX XXXX XXXX permission to obtain or report my personal or credit information. 
Despite this request, no response has been received from XXXX XXXX XXXX, and they continue to report inaccurate and unauthorized information on my credit report. 

Key Issues : Unauthorized Access and Reporting : XXXX XXXX XXXX has been reporting on my credit report without my consent. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, they are not permitted to obtain my personal information or report it to credit bureaus without my explicit permission. Their actions are not only a violation of my privacy rights but may also constitute identity theft. 
Failure to Respond : Both my Debt Validation letter and my Cease and Desist letter were sent in good faith, requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX provide the necessary documentation and cease their unauthorized actions. However, as of today, they have failed to respond to either request, which further compounds the violation of my rights. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt resolution of this complaint and confirmation that XXXX XXXX XXXX is taking the appropriate corrective actions. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: This complaint serves as my formal request for a comprehensive explanation of how your investigation was conducted, along with your method of verification. As outlined in consumer protection laws, proper verification requires sufficient documentary evidence to confirm the accuracy of the reported information. Failure to review essential documents, such as an account application, constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as established in cases like XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). I request that your response include the following details : What evidence did your representatives uncover that led them to conclude the item is reported accurately? What certified documents were reviewed as part of the investigation? Provide a full copy of all information shared with the data furnisher during the investigation. What expenses were incurred by your company to obtain the necessary documents for this investigation? Proof of your timely acquisition of certified documents. Did you speak directly to any representative of the company reporting this information to verify its accuracy? If yes : i. Who was contacted? ii. What was the date of contact? iii. How long was the conversation? iv. What was the representative 's position? v. What telephone number was used? vi. What is the role of the employee from your company who contacted the representative? vii. How long has that employee been with your company? viii. What specific training was provided to this employee for handling investigations of this nature? ix. Were there any emails or written communications exchanged between your company and the representative? If so, provide copies of all related correspondence and documents proving that a reasonable investigation was conducted. Additionally, please provide : The date the delinquency began. The exact date when this item will no longer be reported. I also request a notarized affidavit affirming that all the information you provide is true and accurate, in accordance with my civil rights under federal law. This matter requires a detailed and specific response, not a generic form letter. My original dispute clearly addressed the account in question, and a template response will not suffice. If you are unable to provide all the requested information within the time frame specified by applicable laws, including the FCRA, I demand the immediate and permanent removal of this item from my credit report. The continued reporting of this erroneous entry is harming my credit rating and has caused significant financial and emotional distress. If you fail to provide either the requested deletion or the documentation supporting your investigation, I will enforce my rights through formal legal discovery and depositions. Please be aware that I am knowledgeable about consumer protection laws and civil/federal court procedures, and I am prepared to represent myself pro se to seek a jury trial if necessary. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance : {$1000.00}

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report for account XXXX. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), my requests have been ignored, violating both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the inaccuracies persist. 
FCRA Violations : According to 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors are required to send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting on my account suggests a failure to comply with this requirement.

Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consu
mer files, which has not been upheld in my case.

Reporting inaccurate information violates 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, which prohibits the reporting of incomplete or inaccurate information to credit bureaus.

Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : Account Number : XXXX. 
High Balance : {$0.00} ( discrepant from other bureaus ).

Balance Owed : {$170.00}. 
Date of Last Payment : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Two-Year Payment History : Late payments inaccurately reported for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Account Description : Secured credit card, marked as " Amount in H/C column is credit limit, '' but conflicting details in payment timelines and balances. 
Impact on Creditworthiness : The discrepancies in the reporting by Equifax have caused significant damage to my creditworthiness, leading to denial of financial opportunities and undue stress. Accurate and complete information is critical for fair treatment in financial decisions.

Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction.

Assurance that the reporting will be accurate and consistent moving forward.

If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with relevant agencies such as the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payment Reporting Dear CFPB, I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for failing to correct inaccurate information regarding late payments reported on my credit report. Despite multiple requests for correction ( letters dated XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX ), no changes have been made to resolve this issue, in violation of both the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ). Since my last dispute, nothing has changed, and the errors remain on my credit report. 
FCRA Violations : Under 15 U.S. Code 1666b, creditors must send periodic statements at least 21 days before the payment due date. The inaccurate late payment reporting suggests a failure to comply with this requirement.

15 U.S. Code 1681i mandates that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of information in consumer files. This obligation has not been upheld in my case.

TILA Violations : The Truth in Lending Act requires creditors to provide accurate and timely disclosures to consumers. The incorrect reporting of late payments has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness and financial well-being. 
Summary of Errors and Discrepancies : The reported late payments for this account are inconsistent and inaccurate across different months and reporting periods. Specific discrepancies include : Late payments incorrectly reported for the following months : XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Different late payment statuses reported across credit bureaus. 
Dates of delinquency that do not align with the accounts actual payment history. 
These errors significantly misrepresent my credit history and have negatively impacted my creditworthiness. 
Desired Resolution : Immediate removal of the inaccurate late payment notations from my credit report. 
Written confirmation of the correction. 
If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint further, including potential legal action and filing additional complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other relevant agencies. 
I look forward to your prompt response to this matter. Please send confirmation of the corrections to the address provided above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Late Payments on XXXX  XXXX Account Dear CFPB, I am writing to dispute inaccurate late payments reported on my credit file for the XXXX XXXX account ( Account Number : XXXX ). These late payments, specifically a 30-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, a 60-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, and a 90-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, are incorrect and misrepresent my payment history. 
Nature of the Complaint : Inaccurate Reporting : These late payments are false and inconsistent with my payment records, as I have consistently made on-time payments through autopay. 
Violation of FCRA ( 15 USC 1681i and 1681s-2 ) : Reporting and failing to correct inaccurate information violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

Violation of FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692e ) : Reporting incorrect payment history may constitute a deceptive or misleading practice.

Violation of TILA ( 15 USC 1601 ) : The Truth in Lending Act requires the accurate reporting of credit and payment terms.

Civil Liability Under FCRA ( 15 USC 1681n and 1681o ) : Noncompliance with these requirements subjects the responsible parties to legal penalties.

Summary of Discrepancies Equifax Reported 30-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX late payment for XX/XX/XXXX, and 90-day late payment for XX/XX/XXXX. 
Payments were consistently made on time, and no delinquencies occurred. 
Requested Resolution : I request the following : Conduct a thorough investigation and remove the erroneous late payment entries.

Update my credit file to reflect accurate and truthful information. 
Provide written confirmation of the corrections within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 
Enclosed are supporting documents, including payment records, to validate my claim. I expect your prompt attention to resolve this matter. 
Thank you for your immediate cooperation. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

The accounts below have violated my rights.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions.

15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) ( a ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I called to make a payment and was told it was delinquent and it was determined that it was reported to all credit bureaus. I did not realize as I had moved, been out of town and getting ready to start XXXX XXXX on top of several other things occurring at once. Which happens at times, and usually you get a call or a email or a letter and make a payment. I received nothing. I had asked that if I paid it off that the reporting be removed. The agent said no. The next day it was reported again to the credit bureaus after I had paid it off. My points went down nearly XXXX XXXX. This seems excessive. Credit card companies should make an attempt to reach out to consumers especially since I have never been late more than a couple of days. I have many credit cards and other creditors at least give you a heads up. I have to apply for some loans for XXXX XXXX and this will severely affect my ability to attend. I also will be on the market to buy a house. This will delay effect my ability to do so. Had this balance been with another creditor this would have never happened. This is not an incentive to ever use ALLY for any credit or banking purposes ever again.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, and again on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notice I was impacted by the Equifax Data Breach Settlement. I submitted my claim form for the Equifax data leak, along with my change of address. Since then, I have submitted several forms, but they refuse to acknowledge that I am part of the settlement. I have all the paperwork for my claim submission ; however, they continue to deny my compensation. The Equifax settlement operator insists that I am not part of the settlement. At one point, I was told they couldn't find my claim, and then I was informed that it was submitted after the due date, despite my claim clearly stating that it was submitted on XX/XX/XXXX, well before the XX/XX/XXXX deadline for paperwork submission. 

Additionally, I have proof that I was impacted by the breach, but they will not accept my evidence, which includes the dates filed, the receipt received, and all corresponding emails. It is frustrating that I can demonstrate my claim was filed before the deadline, yet they refuse to recognize it. 

Why won't Equifax take responsibility for their wrongdoing, especially when the documentation clearly shows that my claim was submitted on time? I have been fighting this matter since XX/XX/XXXX and have all the necessary records. I urgently request your assistance in resolving this issue, as this credit company refuses to acknowledge its errors.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am requesting the information regarding the method of verification employed by your bureau to confirm the accuracy of disputed items on my credit report. 

As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumers have the right to know how disputed items on their credit reports are verified. Therefore, I kindly request that you provide me with detailed information regarding the following : The specific method or process used by your bureau to verify disputed items. 
The identity of the entity or entities responsible for conducting the verification process. 

Any documentation or evidence used to substantiate the accuracy of the disputed items. 

I understand the importance of accurate and fair credit reporting, and I appreciate your cooperation in providing me with transparency regarding the verification process. This information is crucial for me to fully understand the basis on which disputed items on my credit report were confirmed as accurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please consider this a formal request to investigate and correct the following inaccurate items on my credit report issued by your agency. These items must be removed in order to show my true credit history. I make this request pursuant to15 USC Section 1681i of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of 1997. As required by the Act, I demand that you re-verify each of these items, and that the inaccurate items be deleted from my record.

Item Number Company Name Account Number Comments 1XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Acct XXXX XXXXXXXX 4 late payments. 


Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, you have thirty ( 30 ) days from your receipt of this letter to re-verify these entries. According to this law, failure to re-verify these items within thirty ( 30 ) days constitutes reason to drop the information from my file.

Also, 15 USC Section 1681i ( d ) requires that you notify me when the items have been deleted. Under 15 USC Section 1681j, there should be no charge for this notification or for the corrected copy of my report. Finally, please send me the names and addresses of all individuals you contacted so that I may follow up with them directly. Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 

Sincerely, _______________ Name _______________ Address _______________ Town, State and Zip _______________ Social Security No _______________ Date of Birth

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Re : Second Dispute for Inaccurate Information Request for Immediate Deletion Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Original XXXX Dear equifax, I am writing to follow up on my previous letter dated XX/XX/year>, in which I requested validation of the collection account listed on my credit report with your bureau. I have yet to receive a satisfactory response or proof of the debt as required under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). As per my initial request, I sought validation of this debt, including documentation such as my signature or a contract to verify its legitimacy. To date, no such verification has been provided. 
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to ensure that all information reported on my credit file is accurate, verifiable, and complete. As the debt in question has not been properly validated, I assert that it is inaccurate and unverifiable. 
Additionally, Section 809 of the FDCPA mandates that a debt collector must validate a debt when requested by the consumer, and failure to do so results in the debt being considered invalid. Since no proper validation has been provided, this debt should be removed from my credit report.

Therefore, I request the immediate deletion of this collection account from my credit report. Failure to comply with this request will leave me no choice but to pursue legal action under both the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which can lead to significant penalties for non-compliance.

Please update me on the status of this dispute within 30 days, as required by law. If this account is not deleted, I will consider taking further action, including filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and seeking legal recourse.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a resolution in accordance with the law.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have been a customer of Capital One credit card for XXXX years. In that time, I have paid thousands of dollars in fees and interest. 
In early XXXX, I brought my account to a zero balance and each month began paying the statement balance in full to avoid any additional fees or interest. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, I experienced an issue in which I was going to be delayed in making the full statement balance payment by one day. I contacted Capital One in advance regarding this. A supervisor committed to refunding the interest charged but advised he could not do so until it officially posted after the next statement was issued, and he advised to call back then. 
I made the minimum payment on the XX/XX/XXXX due date. I paid the statement balance on XX/XX/XXXX. When the next statement was issued, I had been charged {$20.00} in interest. 
I therefore called Capital One on XX/XX/XXXX for the promised refund. Capital One customer service said it was not authorized to issue any refund. I asked for a supervisor, who denied they had said they would refund the interest and also denied the promised refund. 
Furthermore, Capital One 's supervisor stated that Capital One would now charge me interest for XXXX months, rather than just one, even though I had already scheduled a payment for the statement balance for the XX/XX/XXXX payment due, AND had already paid the full statement balance for the prior month. 
How is this legal? 

Also, Capital One randomly has a " XXXX XXXX '' interest rate that I have been charged for non-XXXX XXXX purchases. I have never taken a XXXX XXXX from this credit card. Yet I have been charged this rate, which is nearly 30 % APR. Capital One wrongly classifies purchases made to non-US merchants as XXXX XXXX, even when the merchant does not appear to be outside the XXXX and is clearly an online purchase. Capital One also charges XXXX XXXX fees for purchases made using apps like XXXX or XXXX, even when they are not a XXXX XXXX, but a purchase of goods or services. 
Capital One also maintains a high interest rate even though I have a XXXX XXXX XXXX and exemplary record.

Mortgage
Sub-issue: Closing disclosure or other related disclosures
Consumer complaint narrative:
Data breach Mr Cooper XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Mr. Cooper XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MI XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Notice of Data Breach Dear XXXX XXXX, Nationstar Mortgage LLC ( XXXX Mr. Cooper XXXX writes to inform you of a data security incident at Mr. Cooper that may have involved some of your personal information. If you are not familiar with the Mr. Coope brand : Your mortgage mav have been previousiv acquired or serviced by Nationstar Mortgage LLC o ' XXXX XXXX XXXX ; Your mortgage is or was serviced by a sister brand ' ; Mr. Cooper may be or previously was the servicing partner of your mortgage company ; or You previously applied for a home loan with us.

Although we have no evidence at this time that your information has been misused for identity theft or Traud as a result of this incident, we are contacting you to explain the circumstances of this event, and to provide information about the service we will provide to help you protect yourself. 
What Happened? 
On XX/XX/XXXX, Mr. Cooper detected suspicious activity in certain network systems. Immediately upon detection, we initiated response protocols, launched an investigation with the assistance o cybersecurity experts to determine the nature and scope of the incident, and contacted law enforcement. 
We also made the decision to shut down our systems to contain the incident and in an effort to protect our customers information. Through our investigation, we determined that there was unauthorized acces : to certain of our systems between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. During this period, we identified that files containing personal information were obtained by an unauthorized party. 
What information was Involved? 
The personal information in the impacted files included your name, address, phone number, email address, Social Security number, date of birth. 
What We Are Doing. 
we take the security or the data entrusted to us very seriously. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am demanding immediate clarification regarding the method of verification your bureau uses to confirm the accuracy of disputed items on my credit report. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to know exactly how disputed items are verified. I expect you to provide me with complete transparency about the following : The exact process or method your bureau uses to verify disputed items. 
The identity of the entity/entities responsible for carrying out this verification. 
Any documentation or evidence used to support the accuracy of the disputed items. 
I am fully aware of my rights under the FCRA, and I expect full compliance with this request. If you can not provide verifiable proof for these items.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Formal Demand to Remove Inaccurate XXXX XXXX Account from Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as my third and final demand that you immediately remove the inaccurate XXXX XXXX account information from my credit report. I have previously notified you of the inaccuracies, yet no corrective action has been taken. This ongoing violation of federal law demonstrates negligence and disregard for your legal responsibilities. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, you are legally obligated to ensure that all information you report is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : 1 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information they report. 
2 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) : Upon notice of a dispute, you are required to conduct a prompt and thorough reinvestigation to verify or remove the contested information.

3 15 U.S.C. 1681n : Noncompliance with the FCRA subjects you to civil liability, including actual damages, statutory damages of {$1000.00} per violation, punitive damages, and attorney fees. 
In addition to your violations of the FCRA, multiple court rulings have affirmed the illegality of reporting inaccurate or unverified XXXX XXXX  accounts to credit bureaus : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX United States ( XXXX ) : The court ruled that the federal government wrongfully reported XXXX XXXX arrears to credit bureaus and ordered the records expunged. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The court found that the XXXX XXXX agency violated the paying parents due process rights by reporting arrears without proper notice. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( XXXX ) : The court reversed a decision to report XXXX XXXX  arrears due to a lack of evidence and improper procedures. 

I have solid evidence that the XXXX XXXX  account information you are reporting is false and was provided without proper verification or notice. I have never provided my consent for this account to be reported, which is an additional violation of my rights. 

As a result of your continued failure to comply with federal law, I have suffered significant harm, including financial damages and emotional distress. Therefore, I am demanding : 1 Immediate removal of the inaccurate XXXX XXXX account from my credit report. 
2 Payment of {$1000.00} in statutory damages per bureau for failing to comply with the FCRA, payable to me at the address listed above. 

If you fail to comply with this demand, I will have no choice but to initiate litigation against all three credit bureaus for willful violations of the FCRA and associated damages. In court, I will seek the maximum allowable damages, including statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorney fees. 

This is your final notice. I strongly urge you to take this matter seriously and fulfill your legal obligations. Contact me via email only. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Contact via email only XXXX All rights reserved

However, I have not received adequate documentation or validation confirming the legitimacy of these accounts.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
inaccurate and potentially fraudulent information that is being reported on my credit report by Equifax. I reviewed my credit report on XX/XX/year>, and noticed several discrepancies regarding the following accounts : XXXX  XXXX Account : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ] These accounts are showing inaccurate and incomplete information, including the reporting of late payments for accounts that were closed. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumer reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported on an individuals credit file. Unfortunately, the accounts listed above do not comply with this requirement. 

I have already reached out to XXXX to dispute these accounts directly and requested an investigation into the inaccurate reporting. However, I have not yet received a satisfactory resolution, and the inaccurate information remains on my credit report. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) assist in investigating this matter and taking the necessary actions to ensure that the inaccurate and potentially fraudulent information is removed from my credit report. The accounts in question are causing undue harm to my credit score and violating my rights under the FCRA. 

The actions I request include : 1. An investigation into the reporting of the accounts listed above by Equifax.

2. Removal of all inaccurate information associated with these accounts from my credit report, including any late payment reports for accounts that have been closed.

3. Ensuring that the information is corrected to reflect accurate and complete data as required by the FCRA.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently conducted a review of my credit report and found several items that have caused me significant distress. These items appear to be unverifiable, inaccurate, and questionable. Your agency has failed to ensure the accuracy of the information as required under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports. This statute mandates that consumer reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report.

Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of Inaccurate or Unverifiable Information, you are required to promptly delete or modify any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable during a reinvestigation. If you are unable to provide me with verifiable proof of the accuracy of the disputed items within 15 days of your investigation, these accounts and the related information must be removed from my credit report.

Additionally, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I do not recognize any of the alleged creditors or debt collectors. I have never entered into a valid contract with any of these entities, nor have I engaged in any transactions with them. As such, these accounts are fraudulent and and inaccurate information. 

Moreover, under the Fair Credit Billing Act, my right to privacy has been violated, and this breach infringes upon my rights as outlined in The Privacy Act of 1974. Removing the inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report will help restore my privacy and prevent further violations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My prior landlord, The XXXX XXXX, falsely reported that money was owed to them for unpaid rent 5-6 months after I had moved to a new apartment a mile away with a known forwarding address ( given to them and filed with the post office etc in place before the move ) which wasn't used for the lawsuit they knowingly filed and only served to the apartment once it was vacant. There has never been any attempt to serve any papers to my legal residence, e-mail, or even via newspaper notice as allowed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. They simply reported it to a collection agency that has been updating my reports monthly with increased balances under two different names. The amount began at {$8900.00} in XX/XX/year> and is currently at {$10000.00}. Columbia Debt Recovery is the name they use for XXXX and XXXX, they report this to XXXX under Genesis Credit. Both of these entities are at the same contact info ( address and phone numbers ) in Washington state. 

when I was first aware of the collection, I asked them for this information directly so I could dispute it, which was ignored. I then asked them to stop contacting me, which was respected until earlier this year when they began calling and emailing me again. 

The landlord filed this in retaliation after refusing to make the apartment legally habitable during the covid quarantine. there is endlesss email correspondence back and forth asking for the repairs to be made. they were ignored and money was withheld from the rent in increasing amounts over the course of 6-7 months. complaints with the city were filed but no inspections were being done during the lockdown, nor was it possible for me to arrange any repairs or even move out of the unit. All of this is in email, along with their acknowledgment of owing me thousands of dollars after stealing my property from their on site storage service that only they had access to, they agreed to pay me and then decided not to. 

If a lawsuit was legally filed, they would lose and be countersued for damages. instead they filed these false reports in retaliation which has now made it impossible for me to rent with it on my record. 

The XXXX XXXX  is owned by the XXXX XXXX in XXXX Illinois where I am a resident. this out of state company using two different entities to falsely report amounts that are not owed by me nor allowed as collection fees per law. 

Columbia Debt/Genesis is in at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Washington XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX WA XXXX and phone XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> a friends XXXX was hacked. I wrote to her as usual because I did not know it was hacked. The person pretended it was her talked to me for a bit and then asked me the favor to pay something for her as her app wasnt working. First she asked me to pay {$XXXX} to a XXXX account with the promise to return it later that day. Believing it was her and after she has done many favors to me in the past I didnt wsnt to question her request so did what she said. Later she asked me for {$XXXX} more, I felt uncomfortable because it was a lot or money buy I did it anyway as she promised to return everything later. 
That same night I saw her XXXX account XXXX saying her XXXX was hacked and she wasnt asking for any money. 
I contacted my bank Chase Bank and XXXX about it several times but they said that since I voluntarily sent that money they couldnt do anything. I explained to them I was lied to and my friends XXXX was hacked and I was a victim of a fraud, but they said there was nothing they could do. I reported it to them and to XXXX and also to the FTC but nobody contacted me nor refund me the {$XXXX}. The stress and anger this situation caused me is priceless.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Amsher Collections service claims that as of XX/XX/2024 I owed {$770.00}. 

They stated they updated this balance on XX/XX/2024 as past due under a 1 month term. 
I did not make any agreement with this company under any terms. 

My original agreement was made with XXXX more than 2 years ago. I closed my account with XXXX XX/XX/2024 and switched to XXXX XXXX XXXX  who paid off my remaining equipment balance with XXXX as apart of the deal to switch to their company. Leaving a {$0.00} balance with my previous XXXX account. 

Furthermore, As apart of the contract I signed with XXXX there was an arbitration agreement, which clearly stipulates that any dispute must be resolved through arbitration due to the binding agreement. To date there has been no arbitration proceedings. 

I am writing to formally notify you that your attempts to collect on the alleged debt referenced above are in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 16921692p. If you are not aware this entire claim is regulated by the aforementioned arbitration agreement with XXXX which clearly stipulates that any dispute must be resolved through arbitration due to the binding agreement. To date there has been no arbitration proceedings. As a direct result of that this is considered a material breach of the arbitration terms listed in the original agreement acknowledged by all involved parties. I confidently assert that you have no right to collect on this alleged debt. 

I am writing this as I humbly seek to have this discrepancy resolved both promptly and amicably. 

With that, my demands are as follows : 1. You must promptly notify any credit reporting agency to remove all information and/or tradelines associated with this account. I request a written confirmation of that communication to be sent to the address you have on file ; 2. A settlement agreement that I may retain for my records. 
3. Monetary compensation in the amount of {$1000.00}.

While I do not desire or anticipate that your negligence may force me to purse further legal action, that option will be explored. In the event that needs to happen, you are subject to a significant increase in demands to cover damages, attorney fees, and more. I am sure a company of your caliber does not look to unreasonably be exposed to those routes. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. We look forward to resolving this issue promptly.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

This is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a consumer. 
Details of Dispute : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Disputed Late Payment Entries : o XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o Equifax XXXX XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With discrepancies o XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX With Discrepancies Additional Inaccuracies and Issues 1. Future Reporting Dates : o XXXX and XXXX : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Equifax : Last Reported is XX/XX/XXXX. 
o Reporting dates in the future violates the FCRA 's accuracy and timeliness requirements. 
XXXX. Payment History Discrepancies : o XXXX and Equifax : Show several months with " XXXX late payments ''. 
o XXXX : Shows no similar late payment entries. 
o If the account is listed as " Current, '' there should be no late payments reported. 

XXXX. Comments Conflicts : o XXXX and XXXX : State " Consumer Statement Item in Dispute by Consumer. '' o Equifax : XXXX " Consumer disputes - reinvestigation in progress. '' o These conflicting comments indicate unresolved or inconsistent handling of disputes. 
XXXX. Number of Months ( Terms ) Inconsistency : o XXXX and XXXX : Show 564 months. 
o Equifax : Shows 0 months, which is inaccurate or incomplete. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : o XXXX  : {$480000.00}.

o XXXX XXXX XXXX {$500000.00}. 
o The balance does not exceed the high credit, but it requires proper documentation to ensure accuracy. 
XXXX. Date Discrepancies : o Date Last Active : XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX. 
Equifax : XXXX. 
o Date of Last Payment : XXXX and Equifax : XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX : Missing.

Violation of Consumer Protection Laws : Violations of 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. Reporting late payments on a current account violates this standard.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report. The bureau must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify its accuracy.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, it must be promptly deleted or corrected.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Information furnishers, such as creditors, are prohibited from knowingly reporting inaccurate information.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Upon receiving notice of a dispute, the furnisher must investigate, review relevant information, and report its findings to the credit bureaus.

FCRA Section 607 ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure maximum possible accuracy when reporting consumer information. The reporting of late payments on a current account fails to meet this standard.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : I have the right to dispute any inaccurate information on my credit report and demand a thorough reinvestigation.

FCRA Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) : If the information can not be verified as accurate, it must be deleted promptly.

CFPB Standards : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau mandates that credit bureaus and furnishers maintain fair and accurate reporting practices.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Equifax Subject : Dispute of Hard Inquiry on my Credit Report Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to officially dispute a hard inquiry that is listed on my credit report. After reviewing my credit report obtained from your credit reporting agency, I discovered an inquiry that I did not authorize or recognize. I request an immediate investigation into this matter and ask for the removal of the hard inquiry from my credit profile. 
Details of the hard inquiry : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I would like to highlight the following concerns regarding this hard inquiry : 1. Unauthorized Inquiry : I have not given consent to any other entity to perform a hard inquiry on my credit report. This unauthorized inquiry has been detrimental to my credit score and overall financial well-being.

2. Lack of Information : I am unaware of the specific purpose for this inquiry. I have not engaged in any new credit applications, loan requests, or any other activities that require a hard inquiry during the stated time frame.

3. Possible Error : It is possible that this inquiry has been reported incorrectly, or there may potentially be an identity theft issue. I request a thorough investigation to verify the legitimacy of this inquiry.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to a prompt investigation of this disputed inquiry.

Therefore, I kindly request that you initiate the investigation immediately and provide me with a written response within the legally mandated 30-day period.

Please provide me with the following information upon completion of your investigation : 1. Confirmation of the legitimacy of the hard inquiry.

2. The source of the inquiry.

3. Steps taken to rectify any errors or inaccuracies in my credit report.

4. Verification of the removal of the disputed hard inquiry from my credit profile.

5. Updated copy of my credit report reflecting the amendments made. 
I understand the importance of maintaining accurate and up-to-date credit information. I respectfully request your urgent attention to this matter and appreciate your cooperation in resolving the dispute promptly. 
Enclosed with this letter are copies of relevant documents supporting my dispute. Should you require any further information or documentation from me, please do not hesitate to contact me using the information provided above. 
Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving a satisfactory resolution to this dispute within the designated time frame. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX FTC REPORT ATTACHED

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal demand for compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, regarding my identity theft case. I am the victim of identity theft, and fraudulent accounts, addresses, employment details, and credit inquiries have been unlawfully reported on my credit file. 

Violations of FCRA : Failure to Block Information Resulting from Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Under this section, you must block any information identified as a result of identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving my dispute and required documentation. Failure to do so constitutes a violation of federal law. 

Failure to Reinvestigate Disputed Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : If you fail to reinvestigate the disputed items within 30 days, you are in violation of this section. 
If you reinstate the fraudulent information without notifying me or conducting a reasonable investigation, you may be in further violation. 
Failure to Notify Data Furnishers ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Upon receiving my dispute, you must notify the furnishers of the fraudulent information within five ( 5 ) business days. 

Providing Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : You have a legal duty to maintain accurate credit files. Reporting or failing to correct fraudulent information after being notified is a breach of this obligation. 

Failure to Provide Results of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : After completing an investigation, you are required to provide a written notice of results and any changes made within five ( 5 ) business days.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> I.C.Systems, Inc. 
XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX RE : Notice of Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act Dear I.C.Systems, Inc., I am writing to formally notify you that your attempts to collect on the alleged debt referenced above are in violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 USC 16921692p. If you are not aware this entire claim is regulated by an arbitration agreement with XXXX XXXX, which clearly stipulates that any dispute must be resolved through arbitration due to the binding agreement. To date there has been no arbitration proceedings. As a direct result of that this is considered a material breach of the arbitration terms listed in the original agreement acknowledged by all involved parties. I confidently assert that you have no right to collect on this alleged debt. 

I am writing this as I humbly seek to have this discrepancy resolved both promptly and amicably. 

With that, my demands are as follows : 1. You must promptly notify any credit reporting agency to remove all information and/or tradelines associated with this account. I request a written confirmation of that communication to be sent to the address you have on file ; 2. A settlement agreement that I may retain for my records. 
3. Monetary compensation in the amount of {$1000.00}. 

While I do not desire or anticipate that your negligence may force me to purse further legal action, that option will be explored. In the event that needs to happen, you are subject to a significant increase in demands to cover damages, attorney fees, and more. I am sure a company of your caliber does not look to unreasonably be exposed to those routes. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. We look forward to resolving this issue promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Account Number XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Synchrony Bank would not honor my request to close a 9-month CD I had opened on XX/XX/XXXX for {$50000.00}. I notified them in XXXX, XXXX that I wished to close the account at maturity both verbally and in writing. They refused to take my direction citing that I had to " call '' at the time of maturity ( XX/XX/XXXX ) to request the cancelation. I was traveling and away for XXXX during this period and was unable to call. My CD was automatically " slammed '' renewed for an additional 9 months despite my previous directions. I was never notified in email or letter that the renewal was upcoming. When I finally got a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX notifying me that my CD had been renewed, I called to get that transaction reversed and was told I could not without paying a {$500.00} penalty. I was also told I had received both email and mail communication that the CD was about to renew, but I never received any such communications. 

This is a predatory practice by Synchrony designed to make it difficult for customers to remove their funds from the bank. They give banking customers the ability to fund a CD online ( they are an online banker ) but no option to cancel the same product online. 

Finally, I attempted to notify them again of my direction to close the account when it comes up for renewal again on XX/XX/XXXX. They refused in multiple communications to accept my direction. I find this outrageous and need help getting this resolved.

Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was incorrectly charged {$820.00} by XXXX XXXX for a Collision Damage Waiver ( CDW ) that should have been billed directly to XXXX Insurance XXXX This charge was made to my Discover card. 

After my car was damaged in an accident, XXXX arranged a rental car for me. They confirmed via text message on the rental day that XXXX coverage was included and that XXXX had acknowledged it on their system. However, XXXX erroneously charged me instead of XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year>, I visited the XXXX branch and spoke with the branch manager, XXXX XXXX. He admitted that his staff made a mistake when closing the rental agreement and charged me instead of XXXX. XXXX agreed, as documented in an email exchange with XXXX XXXX, my XXXX case handler, that XXXX would refund me and correctly bill XXXX. 

Despite this agreement, XXXX has not refunded me, and XXXX has stopped providing updates or a timeline for resolution. I filed a dispute with Discover, providing all relevant evidence, including : Text messages from XXXX confirming the CDW arrangement. 
Emails between XXXX and XXXX acknowledging XXXX 's error. 
Documentation showing both XXXX and XXXX agreed I should be refunded. 
On XX/XX/year>, Discover denied my dispute, claiming the transaction was valid without providing a clear explanation. I never received any mail or communication from Discover explaining their reasoning, as promised. 

This situation has caused undue stress and inconvenience, including multiple visits to XXXX and hours spent on calls and disputes. I am left with a charge of {$820.00} for XXXX admitted error. Both XXXX and Discover have failed to take responsibility, leaving me unfairly charged. 

I request CFPBs assistance in resolving this matter and ensuring I receive the refund I am owed. Thank you.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Illegal Sale of Debt and Personal Information by Pacific Credit Services Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Pacific Credit Services , located at [ insert address ], for the illegal sale of my personal information and debt to a collection agency. I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau intervene to resolve this issue and ensure that this company is held accountable for its actions. 

Background and Violations : On XXXX, I discovered that Pacific Credit Services had sold my personal information, including my Social Security Number ( SSN ), address, and other sensitive financial details, to an external collection agency without my consent. This action not only constitutes an invasion of my privacy but also violates several consumer protection laws, including but not limited to : The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 16921692p ) : The unauthorized sale of my debt to a third-party collection agency is an illegal practice. Debt collectors are required to have express consent before taking any action regarding consumer debt. The sale of personal information without my consent is an unlawful practice under this Act. 
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : Pacific Credit Services actions are also in violation of the FCRA, which mandates that companies must handle personal and financial information with care and only share it under very specific conditions. The unauthorized transfer of my debt and personal information constitutes a violation of my rights to privacy and accuracy under this law. 
The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 68016809 ) : This law requires that financial institutions establish privacy safeguards to protect personal financial information. The sale of my personal data to third parties without my consent is a clear violation of these privacy protections. 
California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ) ( if applicable ) : If this issue involves a California resident, the CCPA prohibits the unauthorized sale of personal data and provides consumers with the right to request the deletion of their personal information from companies databases. 
Request for Action : Given the serious nature of these violations, I am requesting that the CFPB take the following actions : Investigate the illegal sale of my debt and personal information by Pacific Credit Services.

Require Pacific Credit Services to delete all records of this sale from my credit report and any records of my personal information being shared with a third party.

Ensure that Pacific Credit Services takes corrective action, including the removal of any outstanding debt associated with the sale of my personal information and ensuring that this data is not further sold or shared without my express permission. 
Consider enforcing penalties for violations of the FDCPA, FCRA, and GLBA, including potential fines or sanctions for their unlawful practices. 
Demand a formal response from Pacific Credit Services acknowledging the violation and providing proof that the debt has been removed from my credit report and deleted from the collection agencys records.

Penal Codes and Consequences : The unauthorized sale of my personal data and debt may result in significant penalties for Pacific Credit Services, including but not limited to : Civil penalties of up to {$1000.00} for each violation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 
Actual and punitive damages under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) for mishandling and misreporting my financial information. 
Substantial fines and penalties under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) for violating privacy protections concerning consumer data.

Given the illegal actions taken by Pacific Credit Services, I am asking the CFPB to take prompt and decisive action to remedy the situation and ensure that my rights as a consumer are fully protected. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response and resolution of this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> a disputed was filed for XXXX and XXXX to correct inaccuracies on credit files. On XX/XX/year> on Credit Karma website a dispute was also filed due to hard inquiries, 2 closed accounts ( XXXX XXXX ) that are unknown accounts that I do not own. 

On Credit Karma website states a dispute does not change score. Within hours my credit score was dropped and stated XXXX dropped score and this is why it changed on credit karma. After logging into XXXX I seen that there was no change in XXXX site only on Credit Karma. 

Credit Karma is in violation of FCRA : 15 USC 1666d 1. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Under Section 604 ( a ) ( 3 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, it is unlawful for any credit reporting agency or bureau to report inaccurate or incomplete information on a consumers credit report. Specifically, accounts that have been charged off and are no longer active should not display open balances. The FCRA mandates that all credit reporting must reflect accurate, up-to-date information about the consumers accounts. Since both of these accounts have been closed and charged off, it is unlawful for them to still show open balances.

2. Inaccuracy in Reporting Closed Accounts The practice of continuing to report open balances on closed, charged-off accounts violates both the FCRA and other consumer protection statutes that require accurate credit reporting. Under FCRA Section 605 ( a ), negative information such as a charge-off is only allowed to remain on the report for a limited time ( typically seven years ), and only if the information is correct and reflective of the actual account status. In my case, the ongoing reporting of these charged-off accounts with open balances is an inaccurate reflection of the current status of these accounts.

3. The Inaccuracy of Reporting Charged-Off Accounts Furthermore, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), it is illegal to report accounts that have been sold, transferred, or charged off as still being active or open when they are not. XXXX  sale of my account to XXXXXXXX XXXX does not mean that the account should remain open or continue to show a balance. The status should reflect the final charge-off and XXXX balance as a result of the sale. 
4. The Legal Requirement for Accurate Reporting The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) also mandates that all consumer information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and timely. The ongoing misrepresentation of these accounts as having an open balance, despite being charged off, creates false information about my financial history, which can lead to unwarranted harm to my creditworthiness.
