Consumer complaint narrative:
I had an XXXX Credit Card for XXXX years and never had any issues with ituntil they abruptly decided to restrict my usage without providing a reason. I discovered this when attempting to pay for a purchase at the supermarket. As a result, I decided to cancel the card. 

Goldman Sachs only provides transaction records through the XXXX XXXX. I have never received a single statement from them. Before closing the account, I was assured that I would still have access to my transactions via XXXX XXXX and that they would mail me all XXXX years of statements. I informed them that my small town does not have a mailman and that we only receive mail via XXXX XXXX XXXX. Despite this, they stated they do not send mail to XXXX XXXX XXXX. Instead, they sent all my data, statements, and sensitive information by standard mail, which likely ended up who knows where! 

They failed to send the package via certified mail, which could have ensured delivery regardless of the XXXX XXXX XXXX. As a result, they effectively handed my sensitive data to anyone who handled that package. 

I contacted them to report that I had not received my statements and requested they resend them via certified mail, XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX to ensure proper delivery. However, they ignored my request and continued to focus on the XXXX XXXX XXXX, refusing to accommodate my situation. To this day, I have not received the statements I need for my taxes! 

Goldman Sachs and their Apple Card support team have mishandled my personal data, potentially exposing it to abuse, while refusing to provide me with my own financial records.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, while making an ATM transaction at the Citibank branch, my banking card was stolen by someone who was already inside the branch when I arrived. There was no XXXX involved, the man, who was a XXXX male, offered unsolicited help with the ATM and proceeded to quickly remove my card from my hand ( which I snatched back as quickly as I could ) and switched it with another person 's card, which I didn't realize until hours later that same day, but not before the thief had stolen all the money in my checking account and made a {$70.00} purchase on my debit card at a nearby shoe store. To my surprise, he withdrew {$2500.00} at the Citibank teller 's window at the same branch where he had stolen my card, and then proceeded to walk to the Citibank ATMs inside the branch and withdrew another {$1400.00}. There were plenty of red flag signs that the teller should have picked up on. First, the amount was unusually high, in fact I think it is the highest withdrawal amount permitted in a day. Second, my account has a woman 's name on it ( as I am a woman ), and I do not have a Spanish name ( as I am not of XXXX or XXXX origin ), and the thief was a XXXX male. The tellers at that branch are all XXXX because there is a large Spanish-speaking community there and I imagine they are familiar with names that don't appear to fit the description of their customers. Third, when my account information was pulled up by the teller, that teller should have noticed that minutes earlier I had withdrawn {$60.00} from the ATM so to make a withdrawal of thousands of dollars at the teller window immediately after having already completed a transaction at the machine, is unusual. 

In any event, Citibank conducted 3 separate investigations, for the {$2500.00}, the {$1400.00}, and the {$70.00}. Citibank credited my account for the {$70.00} on the same day of the theft. They have not communicated any information to me regarding the results of their investigation of the {$2500.00} withdrawal that was done at the teller 's window. For the {$1400.00} ATM withdrawal, they posted the results of their investigation via a notification letter to my account. They did not call or email me to let me know about the letter or that their investigation was complete. I only discovered the letter when I happened to check my account to see if Citibank was still blocking the account. The letter stated that the thief used both my card and pin # to make the withdrawal and the withdrawal was consistent with my banking habits ( even though I have never withdrawn such a large amount at an ATM before ). The letter stopped short of explicitly concluding that Citibank was not accepting any responsibility for my loss but the tone and tenure of the letter certainly suggests that they are holding me financially responsible.

Company: John C. Heath, Attorney at Law, PLLC

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Monday XX/XX/year>, i collected a check through my lawyer in the sum of {$4000.00}. 

This check is an advance on an accident claim in which i was struck by a vehicle on XX/XX/year>. 

this check is to help me aquire essential items like food, clothing and transportation whilst recovering, since it has been 3 months since the accident i have exhausted my funds whilst trying to cope with my recovery and inability to return home to earn a living. in dire need of funds i took this cash advance. 

i collected the check on monday XX/XX/XXXX and took it to chase bank with whom i started banking shortly before the accident asked the teller to deposit the check. she noted that the check would take 24hrs to clear as it came from another bank. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) i said it wasn't an issue since 24hrs wouldn't affect me. the following morning i sign into my bank account only to notice to my absolute horror, that the deposited now showed a message saying that JP MORGAN CHASE was going to hold my check until XX/XX/XXXX ... XXXX day. i immediately called the bank to find out what on earth was happening and why my check was being held. 

Upon calling chase the agent told me that the check was being help because XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX '' wouldn't release the check. and any information to 3rd parties, this sounded ridiculous to me as it would mean that the countries largest banks do not have a secure method of communicating with each other. I asked the agent what she would need to release the hold on my check, she then transferred me to holding department. the agent i spoke to there said they needed the phone number of the business or owner of the business the issued the check. the issuing company is XXXX XXXX i have had no knowledge or dealings with this company before requesting this answer and all contracts and communication were taken care of by my lawyer. I explained this to the agent and requested them to hold whilst i reach out to my lawyer. My lawyer then provided me with the name and number of the gentleman who owns the business and i returned to call with the chase agent and provided the number. the agent seemingly input the number into a system and then proceed to tell me that the number wasn't in their system, now i have no way of knowing how they attempted to verify this number, or if they even did, i provided the information they requested and even called the owner of the business, at one point i conferences the call with him and the agent. to make a long story short chase continued to deflect the blame away from themselves holding my check onto XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX even though XXXX XXXX confirmed with me that not only had XXXX XXXX  XXXX, already taken the funds from his account, they also tried reaching out to chase on his behalf and chase refused to assist, claiming they couldn't confirm whether or not the person calling was indeed from XXXX XXXX XXXX 

i let chase know the purpose of the check and that i urgently needed the money providing them, with not only the contact information for the issuer but also for my lawyer with whom they could easily verify any information they needed about the situation. the check also clearly stated what it was for in the comment section with the words " CASE LOAN ''. it is XX/XX/XXXX and i so do not have access to the funds that i desperately need. chase has never had any issues with me or my account in the few months i've been with them. all my deposits have been in person and in cash for with the few exceptions of XXXX transactions between my mother and younger brother for small amounts the largest being just over {$100.00}. usually going from me to one of them. 


water does stand out as suspicious is that my credit which i have with chase becomes due for payment on XX/XX/year> and is one of the reasons i got this advance. should i have gotten my funds on time i would have be able to clear out my credit card usage a little over {$700.00} at the time of deposit. chase would not get any interest on my card usage, however with my funds being held till XXXX day, chase has guaranteed themselves a fat interest on what is now my XXXX XXXXXXXX credit statement that has increased rapidly due to them holding my check forcing me to use my credit card for for transportation and food and other essentials that i would have otherwise been able to do with the funds from my deposits. their deliberate act of holding my funds without good reason other than " they can '' allows them to take advantage of my upcoming card statement, to milk me with interest even though i should have funds in my account. even though it is them, JP MORGAN CHASE AND NOT XXXX XXXX XXXX THAT IS HOLDING MY CHECK. 

Not only that, there was a scheduled home equity payment with chase home finance that was made and then returned because the transaction put my account in a negative even though the deposit had already been made and was being held by chase themselves this subtle control of my funds to eek out a hefty interest from me simple because " they can '' is nothing short of strong arming me knowing i'm in a desperate situation and can't do anything to fight the mighty J.p. morgan chase.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
This would be my second time reporting as I will be submitting a report to the bbb and also to other government filers in regards to kid off. I disputed kik off due to inaccurate reporting and information. Kik has done there investigation and verified it was accurate also use fcra laws in response when clearly violating mines more than one actually. Thats investigation is not true I pulled all three credit reports and they DO NOT report the same information on all three credit reporting agencies. XXXX, XXXX, XXXX. Lets start with the double entries of charge off. It has come to my attention that the charge-off is being reported month after month on my payment history, which is incorrect. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), negative information such as a charge-off should only be reported once, corresponding to the date it was charged off.

The FCRA requires that credit reporting agencies ensure the accuracy of the information they report ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). Repeatedly reporting the charge-off each month results in a misleading and inaccurate credit report, which has significantly harmed my credit score.Additionally, the statute of limitations for reporting a charge-off is seven years from the date of the first delinquency that led to the charge-off ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 4 ) ). Continuously reporting this charge-off as a new event each month does not reset the statute of limitations and is improper. I have made them aware and they chose to keep it on my report. I pull up the information from Kirk on the app and it does not match what the response was in the letter let alone the utilization rate shows on the credit report. which is wrong and misleading. I was recently denied an treated unfairly due to what they were reporting. This accounts needs to be removed from all three credit reporting agencies as they are not reporting accurate or the same on either credit reporting agency credit report of mine. I am also requesting payment for damages under 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance-If any credit reporting agency or furnisher willfully fails to comply with the terms of the FCRA, it is liable to the consumer for actual damages or statutory damages between {$100.00} and {$1000.00}, punitive damages, and the consumers reasonable attorneys fees and costs. Per FCRA 15 USC 1681 A ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) -Exclusions- transactions are not included on the credit report. LATE PAYMENTS ARE A FORM OF A TRANSACTION. With late payments reporting to the credit report this is a direct violation of the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT. THESE are actual fcra laws that kick off must abide by I requested it for it to be removed once and they didn't now im requested damages and removal from all three. Below I will show my finding a shows each reporting from the credit ensures and how kid off is reporting. all credit reporting agencies must report the same information an its not. Also my account with kik that I have will show that and the actual close date of XXXX not XXXX as XXXX responded from kik an the utilization rate of 9 % and its reporting different on the credit bureaus. I also attached the fill response from XXXX. Kik off had a chance to make it right but I not this account needs to be removed immediately or further. legal action will take place.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> my car was repossessed, not due to me not making payments. It was due to XXXX XXXX XXXX not giving me prior notice about a transfer and Peritus Portfolio Services for not given me proper notice of the transfer. I attempted to make a payment on XX/XX/year> on my auto loan through XXXX portal with XXXX XXXX but the portal wasnt working. I call the finance company XXXX XXXX and the number was out of service. I then call the dealership XXXX their number wasnt working. So i check my email and saw a message posted on XX/XX/year> bout my account is being transfer to Peritus and that the company had file for bankruptcy and had a number provided. I call the number provided to inquire about my account with them since the email stated i should had received a letter within 2 weeks of XX/XX/year> but didnt get any notice. So the guy ask me to verified some info once verified I ask him can he give me my account info and the link to make payment since I couldnt make a payment with XXXX XXXX payment portal. The guy told me he couldnt help me and that in fact i reach the wrong dept so he place me on hold to transfer me to customer service. After 10 mins he said nobody pick up so he was goin to place a note saying am looking for letter and payment info. After 2 weeks went by I call again to Peritus on XX/XX/year> to see what was goin on because i still didnt receive the letter or hear back and my account is now about to be 2 months late. Sound like the same guy answered the phone and it was the same scenio. I ask the guy can he give me the correct number so I wont be calling the wrong dept but i was rushed off the phone. So I was instructed to wait for the letter. And i never got that letter. So from that time after XXXX i been looking for legal help with my situation because I couldnt understand how the guy can veirfied my info but coudnt provide me with the account number, payment info or even tell me when the letter was exactly mail to me. I recheck my my email and I saw it was an letter attach to the XX/XX/year> email saying that XXXX XXXX XXXX was forwarding their number to Peritus number. That right there had red flag up for me because I look up was it legal for one business to merge their number to another business. And it stated it only legal if it within the same company and XXXX XXXX and Peritus is not the same company. So I did call back before the auction date of XX/XX/year> to make arrangement to pay the past due balance off but I never received info from Peritus about the transfer so I didnt feel comfortable sending my money to them. On XX/XX/year> I requested for the contract with Peritus and XXXX XXXX since Peritus mention the transfer was court ordered I requested for the info to for clarification, payment history from XXXX XXXX. And none of the requested documents was send to me. XXXX end up sending me a bill collector letter which is not the same as the transfer service of letter. And as of today my car havent been sold after it was stated that it was being auction off at a private sale on XX/XX/year>. I havent received any further correspondence from XXXX since XX/XX/year> of the bill collector letter. I believe both companies shown lender liability by breach of contract, wrongfully repo of my car, negligent, confusing communication, fiduciary relationship, and loan packing. I will attach 2 documents that was provided and please let me know if any of these documents are a valid and correct transfer of service letter. I would like to also add that request to opt out of SMS or text communication to XXXX XXXX XXXX so by Pertius saying I receive a text from the company will violate my rights of text communication because I ask them to stop communicating through text messages. Oh and I had find out that the car dealership and finance company are one company because they do in house finance. 

Thank you for your time.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a Cash App card that I regularly send money to for spending purposes every week, whether I swipe my Cash App card or take it off at a usual ATM. One week, I noticed the entirety of my usual weekly funds was taken off my card. I also noticed someone had been checking my balance remotely, which I have no clue of how to do, for sometime to see when i checked my email for receipt of the stolen money. Upon viewing this transaction, I noticed a few other times I wondered where my money had gone, someone checked my balance remotely before taking the remaining balance. Knowing the l would have a problem disputing the smaller and older transactions, I only disputed the 3 larger and more recent transactions. I contacted Cash App with proof that I was at work the time of the transaction ( s ) and would not have enough time to make to it my next shift in time for the other, proof of the multiple remote inquiries before the withdraws, and proof of the locations where the withdraws took place. In hopes these many photos and locations that were not usual spots of my transactions would help my case, I submitted my claim. I was approved on a single transaction, which was one half of a double withdraw transactions, and denied on the the other two. Clueless as to how I could be denied on one half of a double transaction at the same place, I resubmitted the transaction for dispute again along with the one at an unknown store and submitted additional proof. I was denied again and my account was closed. I lastly called Cash App support and tried to resubmit my claim by explaining to a representative how my Cash App card must have been duplicated by a skimmer and the whole situation. The rep put in the claim and also an appeal on the reopening of my account. Again I was denied and it has been 2 month with no response on my account appeal. Being an avid user with this experience, I fear Cash App are nothing but thieves working with criminals to help steal all our hard-earned money.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please note t

hat this is not a refusal to pay off the account but a notice sent as per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( F.D.C.P.A. ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 ( G ) Section 809 ( B ). This notice states that your claim is disputed and validation of the account is required. This notice is not a request for verification of the account or proof of my mailing address but a request for validation made pursuant to the F.D.C.P.A. laws. I humbly request that your agency/ office sends me valid proof of claim that I am legally obli
gated to pay you. 

Please provide me with the below mentioned items : * The amount you claim the XXXX owes you * An explanation showing me how you have computed the amount. 
* Copies of any documents that prove I agreed to pay the alleged amount * The identity of the original creditor * Confirmation that the account has not crossed the statute of limitation ( XXXX ) period * Evidence that you are a licensed debt collector * Evidence of your license numbers and your registered agent. 

I would like to inform you that your agency has reported invalidated account information to any of the XXXX main credit bureaus such as XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and will be regarded as a fraudulent action under both federal and state statutes. Due to this reason, any negative item reported to any of my credit reports by your agency or the agency that you represent, I will be compelled to take legal steps against you for the below mentioned reasons : * Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( F.C.R.A. ) * Violation of the F.D.C.P.A. 
* Defamation of character * Use of my copyrighted property I would like to further inform you that if any action is taken during the validation period which could be regarded as detrimental to any of my credit reports, then I will seek advice about initiating a potential lawsuit. This includes listing any information on a credit report that could be incorrect or invalidated, or confirming an account as correct when, in fact, there is no provided evidence that it is.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon reviewing my dispute results from confirmation XXXX XXXX, I've noticed multiple errors being reported. The following account must be deleted from my credit file due to the continuous discrepancies and missing information being reported : XXXX XXXX XXXX - Account ending in XXXX - Reported Balance : {$9700.00}. This account has been disputed multiple times. Some dates include XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>. Equifax has reinvestigated this account multiple times and this account is very misleading. 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) states " If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. '' Please note the furnisher has a duty to correct and update information pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( 2 ). It was said on the results received that the creditor has " verified '' information but there are multiple fields that are missing and dates that are incorrect such as date of the last payment and balances shown. 
I demand immediate deletion of this account in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act.

I am writing to formally address a concerning situation involving a company called Genesis Credit Management. Over the past several months, I have been subjected to unethical and unprofessional practices that appear to violate my rights as a consumer. 
Unethical Use of Personal Information : It appears that my personal information was improperly obtained by Genesis Credit Management from my original creditor. This was done without my consent and raises serious concerns about data privacy and compliance with consumer protection laws. 
Unprofessional Behavior : I have received multiple calls from this company using different phone numbers, creating a sense of harassment. Additionally, I received a text message from an individual who identified himself as an employee of Genesis Credit Management, requesting that I send money. This same individual called me and discussed my personal information in a highly unprofessional manner, further eroding trust. 
Negative Impact on Credit : This company has negatively impacted my credit score by adding accumulated interest and reporting information that may not align with fair credit practices. 
Spam Calls : In addition to the aforementioned issues, I have been inundated with spam calls from this company, further compounding the distress caused by their actions. 

These actions not only violate my rights as a consumer but also demonstrate a blatant disregard for ethical and professional conduct.

Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
Over the past year, I have been a victim of identity theft and fraud. I have had XXXX major credit cards affected as well as XXXX of my checking account. The complaint I would like to make is in regards to my American Express XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
My credit limit with the credit card was {$8500.00}. There were fraudulent transactions occurring on my account for XXXX year with several recurring payments from September 2023-September 2024. American Express did not catch these fraudulent charges, and I unfortunately accrued a balance of close to {$6500.00}. Had Amex have had a better fraudulent detection on my account, I would have received the assistance to report them sooner. Nonetheless, XXXX XXXX  of this year I reported all of the fraudulent charges. Amex was able to remove all of the charges on my account, but in addition, they reduced my credit limit to {$1000.00}. This has affected my XXXX XXXX thoroughly, and I wish that they did not do this. I explained to them my thanks for removing the fraudulent charges and I disputed the credit limit decrease. They denied my credit limit dispute but could not seem to provide me with a good explanation to why. When talking with several customer service representatives about this, they just said it was due to the high number of transactions on my account and my XXXX score. I explained to them that the high number of transactions were due to the fraudulent transactions on my account and that I should not be penalized for this. In addition, my XXXX score was affected throughout the year the fraudulent charges occurred, by since XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX  I have since recovered my XXXX score from " poor '' to " good '' since the identity theft and fraudulent claims have been resolving. I explained that the decrease in my credit limit was also going to worsen the progress I have made. I kept being told by customer service to " just wait 30 days and request a new credit limit increase '' but no one seemed to understand that I was unfairly penalized by having the credit limit lowered in the first place. 
It seems like Amex is not doing a consistent, thorough, and holistic review of this situation. 
It is also extremely strange that Amex decided to lower my credit limit AFTER I reported fraudulent transactions and not DURING the period the fraudulent transactions were being done on my account. This is likely because of the poor fraud detection.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am writing to file a formal complaint against Huntington Bank regarding unauthorized transactions on my debit card, mishandling of my fraud claim, and severe negligence that has caused significant personal and financial distress. 

Incident Overview : On XX/XX/year>, my Huntington Bank debit card was used without my authorization. I had flown from XXXX, FL, to XXXX XXXX, MI, for a camping trip earlier that day. Upon returning and logging into my account, I discovered several unauthorized transactions totaling {$5700.00}. I immediately reported the fraudulent activity to Huntington Bank and locked my debit card. 

Fraud Details : Subsequently, I realized that my XXXX and XXXX XXXX accounts were hacked. The unauthorized party used my XXXX XXXX account to intercept two-factor authentication ( XXXX ) texts. Upon discovering this, I changed all relevant passwords and promptly informed Huntington Bank of the updated fraud details. 

Huntington Bank chose to refund only two transactions from a company named XXXX, which occurred around the same time as the other fraudulent transactions. This selective refund process raises serious concerns about how Huntington determines which transactions are fraudulent. Their approach appears arbitrary and deceptive, further highlighting the bank 's unprofessional handling of my case.

Huntington Bank 's Response : Despite my timely report and multiple appeals ( at least two or three ), Huntington
Bank repeatedly denied my fraud claim. I requested evidence supporting the bank 's determination that the transactions were authorized, but Huntington failed to provide adequate documentation.

Additionally, I requested a replacement debit card multiple times. A Huntington representative falsely claimed the card was shipped but returned. This was demonstrably untrue, as I received other correspondence from Huntington Bank at the same address, including a letter containing my ATM PIN.

Consequences of Huntington Banks Negligence : As a direct result of Huntington Banks mishandling of my fraud claim, I could not pay my rent and was evicted, leaving me homeless. This experience caused tremendous emotional distress and severe hardship. Huntington Banks lack of transparency, failure to deliver critical financial tools, and repeated denials have been both unjust and harmful.

Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to dispute certain inquiries that have appeared on my credit report, which I believe are the result of identity theft and unauthorized actions. I demand proof bearing my signature or electronic signature as evidence that I authorized these actions. These actions violate my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 605B and Section 604. I have contacted the companies responsible for reporting these actions and have confirmed that they initiated them without proper validation or any original proof from me. These inquiries are not legitimate, as I never authorized them, making them the result of identity theft or illegal reporting of my consumer information by creditors or third-party data furnishers. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Credit Bureaus are required to investigate these accounts and inquiries and delete or block them no later than four business days from receiving this letter. I have attached relevant sections of the FCRA, including 605B and 604, which explain the process for blocking information resulting from identity theft and outline the permissible purposes of consumer reports. Please conduct a thorough investigation into the accounts and inquiries listed and delete or block them immediately based on the investigation results or in case of non-compliance. Failure to comply with these regulations will lead to legal action as outlined under FCRA 616, including actual damages and declaratory relief. Unauthorized Inquiries are from the following companies : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I requested validation for this account on XXXX -- - **Subject : ** Follow-Up on Debt Validation Request and FDCPA Concerns Dear XXXX XXXX, Thank you for getting back to me about the debt associated with the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I appreciate your acknowledgment of my dispute and your efforts to contact the creditor for validation. 

However, your response does not fully address the issues I raised in my initial letter, specifically : 1. **Validation Timeline : ** While you have indicated that youve requested validation from the creditor, I request clarification on when you expect to receive and forward the requested documents. The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) requires timely validation to ensure compliance with my consumer rights. 

2. **FDCPA Violations : ** My initial correspondence detailed potential violations of the FDCPA, including : - Adding unauthorized fees to the alleged debt.

- Attempting to collect a debt that I dispute or do not owe.

- Failing to provide the required validation notice within five days of your initial contact. 

Please provide a direct response to these specific concerns, including any steps you have taken to ensure compliance with the FDCPA.

3. **Cease Collection Activities : ** Until the debt is fully validated, I reiterate my demand that all collection activities cease, including further communications with me about this matter. 

4. **XXXX XXXX XXXX : ** I appreciate your confirmation that Transworld Systems has not reported this account to credit reporting agencies. Please confirm that no reporting will occur unless and until the debt is fully validated. 

5. **Next Steps : ** If validation is not provided within 30 days or if it is determined that the debt is not valid, I expect confirmation in writing that this account has been closed and that no further collection activities will take place. 

Please ensure all responses and documentation are sent to my address listed above. If this matter is not resolved satisfactorily, I am prepared to escalate the issue further by filing formal complaints with the FTC, and my state attorney general. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving a clear and comprehensive resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX ---

He told me his company was about to embark in a transaction and when it was complete, he could accept my new investment. Several days later I received an email from XXXX indicating that the event had occurred and they were ready to accept my new investment. On that day or the day after, all of my emails disappeared. Shortly thereafter, I received many emails, including the one I had lost from XXXX ( or at least I thought it was from XXXX ). The email was identical to the previous XXXX he had sent and included a separate XXXX document with wire transfer information. I communicated with XXXX via email ( again it was the fake XXXX who had hacked the real XXXX 's email ) and confirmed that I would be sending {$1.00} XXXX. He told me he would acknowledge receipt and shortly after I initiated the wire, he acknowledged receipt. To be clear, the email I was now communicating with was XXXX 's email except it had an " XXXX '' at the end that I simply did not notice. My computer recognized him and his name popped up rather than the email address. I realized the fraud within XXXX hours and contacted XXXX to confirm that he had not actually received my money or communicated with me after his first email. Which he confirmed. The money went to a branch of Bank OZK in XXXX I spoke to my bank, XXXX XXXX XXXX, as well as bank OZK and tried to get them to claw back the money immediately. Instead of the regular account for XXXX 's company which would be XXXX XXXX XXXX the account at the bank was in the name of XXXX XXXX. Again, I did not notice the insignificant discrepancy and thought it was intentional. In any event, I have yet to get any of my money back or receive any adequate cooperation from bank 0Z8. In my opinion, they should not have allowed the depositor ( who I am sure must have only recently opened the account and probably via remote access ) to receive and withdraw {$1.00} XXXX within a XXXX hour time frame with all the rampant fraud going on involving wire transfers. I was so confident that mine was legitimate because it was a continuous conversation with XXXX both in person and via email. Obviously, this has a huge impact on me and I am thankful for all the help you can give me.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I am a nurse and I have to go in for XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I will be out of work and recovering for several weeks to come. Now, after XXXX yrs of having several accounts with Wells Fargo- my address was changed online in XXXX of XXXX and they claimed it was me. They closed my account on XX/XX/XXXX. They claim it was the XXXX XXXX due to address verification. The address that was put into the system was the physical address of my post office box - but in reverse. I did not do this and I have been using a XXXX XXXX XXXX numerous years now due to my ex-husband and his brother who works for Wells Fargo. I went into the branch at XXXX pm my time in Kansas on XX/XX/XXXX and spent approximately XXXX XXXX hours trying to get my account fixed. The branch XXXX XXXX XXXX told me the closing process on my account was already started and they would try to get me a check the next day ( Saturday XX/XX/XXXX ) and gave me an appointment at XXXX am. I had my realtor send a copy of my contract to purchase my house in XX/XX/XXXX to prove my address at their request and satisfied all address issues in question. My husband was on the phone with me and was quite upset with them and they threatened to call the police to have me escorted from the building because it was now after XXXX and they said they couldnt do anything else. He told them I was a customer and in the building before they closed and needed to resolve the matter before I was sent away. XXXX XXXX and a man said if I refused to leave the police would be called to escort me out. There was no need for that at all because I was not rude or loud or anything. That is unprofessional and quite unacceptable to take all monies from my accounts and freeze them - leaving me with nothing especially during the XXXX XXXX. I reluctantly left and returned at my appointment time the next day and was directed to another man who said he would help as XXXX was busy. He then told me nothing could be done and I could not even get a check to open another account. He said I would have to wait to speak to the XXXX to find out when. He said he could print me previous statements and then printed statements for a joint account I had with my ex-husband that had been closed nearly a year ago. My husband was simply asking direct questions and requested that they fix this problem today and he snapped back that it was the XXXX XXXX, my husband and most of his family are veterans and this upset him. He told the man this and the man used the excuse that it was after XXXX yesterday and they couldnt fix anything because it was too late. My husband told him when it was XXXX in Kansas it was XXXX in California and that whoever they needed to call to resolve this should still be available because they wouldnt tell someone in California that it was too late. He replied XXXX its tomorrow in XXXX and that he was being snippy. I wasnt able to speak to the XXXX XXXX until after XXXX when she told me she couldnt do anything. The account was already closed and the process for the check had already been sent yesterday with my funds. She told me I would have to wait XXXX business days before I could come in and request to have another check issued if I didnt receive it. I asked for the stop payment on the check they had already sent and issue me another one and she replied they couldnt do that because I might receive and cash the other check. I told her that was not possible if the check was stopped and she told me that it hadnt been sent yet, the process takes time to be sent and then go through the mail. I asked again why they couldnt stop the process or even give me a loan for the amount in my accounts. She replied I would need an account in good standing for over a year to be eligible for a loan. At this point I was in tears, I have XXXX in 2 days and will be unable to open another account or even have my bills paid and my checks deposited until I am well enough to go back into a branch when I receive my funds. To top it off it is XXXX and I am left with no money whatsoever. There has to be something that can be done to prevent this from happening again or to others.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX discharged my entire student loan XX/XX/XXXX and for some odd reason Nelnet acquired the loan the same day. Great Lakes was my actual loan servicer when I signed documents with XXXX. Looking at my credit report it indicates that Great Lakes closed my account XX/XX/XXXX. With this information it also states on my credit report that the loan was transferred. It does not indicate to whom the account was transferred to. Looking further into my credit report I see I now have a loan with Nelnet, in which they claimed to have acquired the loan via transfer from Great Lakes. When I look at my information on my FASFA account it shows that my loan with XXXX is at {$0.00} and that the loan was paid in full by consolidation. After speaking to a representative for the Dept. of Education I was informed that the loan showing in the system is not linked to any school. Yet the loan visible on my credit is to Nelnet. I have received a letter from the department of education dated XX/XX/XXXX that my loan is eligible for complete discharge but Nelnet will not delete the balance. Further more I have not signed any documents with Nelnet agreeing to consolidate any loans. But after further investigation it seems as though Great Lakes sold all signed documents/ accounts to Nelnet without informing borrower and then closed there business. Nelnet is now acting as Great Lakes because of a ( cash ) transaction conducted between both companies which allowed Nelnet to take on and take over accounts with borrowers unbeknownst them. What I don't understand and what concerns me is how business was conducted amongst said companies without the knowledge of borrowers and allowed to be legal and reported on the borrowers credit without the consent of the borrower?

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX Pleasant Hollow XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Upstart Network , Inc . 
Re : Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Account Number : XXXX XXXX Upstart Network , Inc, I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information you are reporting on my credit file concerning the above-referenced account. This account rights have been sold to third party XXXX XXXX XXXX per XXXX and XXXX, yet Upstart is still reporting it as a closed account on my credit file. This is inaccurate and misleading, causing harm to my credit profile. 
By continuing to report false and misleading information, you are in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Additionally the actions of Upstart XXXX XXXX XXXX violate the Tennessee Consumer Protection Act ( TCPA ), XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which prohibits unfair and deceptive practices, including but not limited to : Misrepresentation of the information reported to credit bureaus. 
Failure to provide accurate information on my credit file.

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Your obligation to ensure maximum accuracy of the information reported.

Im sending this demand letter so that you immediately delete this inaccurate and harmful information from my credit file. Under the FCRA, I may have the right to pursue statutory damages ( up to {$1000.00} per violation ), as well as actual damages and punitive damages if it is determined that there was willful and negligent noncompliance.

I will take appropriate action under both the FCRA and TCPA, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Tennessee Attorney General 's Office, and pursuing legal action if necessary.
